Reviews.Title: “Good Location Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: greg s
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is small. The 100 sq. ft. or so in our room left space for little else than a double bed. The breakfast area is too small for the number of guests requiring one to hang around for a table to open. The one elevator is used for both guest and housekeeping activity and is very slow -- and small, too. Manhattan is pricey but there are much better properties for a night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sp875
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in March 2012, staff were friendly and helpful! Clean and comfy bed and great shower, all you need after a day taking in NYC!! The free breafast was a convienience and good but sometimes a little busy. Would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great considering its location. However, the rooms are very very tiny! But who cares, when traveling in NYC, you only sleep in your room. Breakfast area is alos very small, you sometimes need to take your breakfast back to your room since there are no places available for you to eat in the "breackfast" room. The staff was very curtious and helpfull. If you are travelling by plane through JFK, a private cab service will drive you there for 60$. The hotel makes all the arrangements for you upon request. I suggest the private cab service, do not use the "shared van" shuttle service....it will take you forever to get to the hotel. When we arrived we used that service and it was not worth the savings. A short walk to the 72nd street subway station, 4 stops you're in Times Square! A short walk to the American Museum of Natural History not to forget Central Park just around the corner. Prices are high considering the size of the room, but you pay for the location. The area is really safe, felt very secure walking around at the wee hours of the night coming back from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kara_2323
Reviews.Content: Me & my Boyfriend stayed here for 1 week during March 2012 the first thing I will mention is the location is AMAZING! your literally 10 mins from Central Park, there is a subway a block away and The Natural History Museum is right round the corner! Not to mention down the road is "Big Nicks" one of the best places to eat cheaply we went 3 x in one week for $2 giant pizza slices and $9 Sumo Burgers and $3 Beers :):):) The staff are friendly and welcoming and always on hand to help, we had free breakfast every morning but only ate it once as we were always so exhausted from all the walking we had done the previous day we would never get up in time! but the time we did go there is yoghurt, muffins, sausages, scrambled eggs, toast, tea & coffee - the only thing I will recommend is get there early otherwise you may not get a seat and have to eat standing up or invade someone else's table like we did! I will be honest and say the rooms are small almost box like but doesn't mean they weren't comfortable and accomadating, we had lovely hot showers daily, a large tv to watch a host of American tv on, a safe to keep our belongings in, fresh towels and bed linen everyday without fail and enough space to hold all our luggage :) it was also quiet and are air-con worked for us when it become too stuffy in the room :) The final thing I will mention is the lift now I fell in love with its eccentric nature because the lift has a mind of its own, we were on the 8th floor but for some reason it would always stop at the 5th and there would be no-one there and when we were going down the lift would miss us completely - drove my Boyfriend mad but I found it quite amusing how the lift had a mind of its own so be wary but take it in good humor! :D Other than that I loved this hotel and everything it provided it overachieved my expectations and helped us fall in love with the city so we will be the first ones booking this place again whenever we return to the big apple :) - Kara & Howard (England)

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great staff, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Fudders
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights here and have to recommend the hotel. Myself and partner had concerns about some of the reviews regarding bed bugs, room size and breakfast availability. On our trip: Bed Bugs: first thing we looked for in the bed. Happy to report none were seen/felt during our stay. Infact we had fresh sheets and a comfy bed. Breakfast: This is a small room and there are issues with getting a table. We got there at 7 most mornings so were ok but one day we got there at 8.30 and there was a small que so we went elsewhere and paid. The brekkie is surprisingly good though. Room size: we were upgraded FOC to a Queen on arrival, I guess this is due to availability so won't always happen. The room was still small but more than adequate for our needs. Our only problem was a noisy radiator in the night which broke up our sleep a little. Other: The location is great, quiet but 100yds from Central Park and 200 Yds from a Downtown subway. The staff are great especially Thomas on reception who was fantastic. He showed genuine interest in us and gave us good advice when asked, good job. If you can put up with a small room and also a slow lift system then I would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking location & lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Michelle0005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of February and loved it. Cracking location as the hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from Central Park and Strawberry Fields. Loved Central Park and I suppose I am a little biased as the boyfriend proposed to me there during our stay...I said yes by the way! The room was just what we wanted as when your in NYC you don't go to stay in your room the whole time as there is too much to see and do. Hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I can't comment on breakfast as we never managed to get in there as there are only a limited number of tables and seemed to be busy whatever time we went. This did not put us off though as we ate out on the move as there are many street vendors selling pastries/cakes etc and also pancake places. The tubes were very easy to use and there is a tube station on 72nd street and you can get around everywhere very quickly so our location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option in a fancy NYC neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AmeriEuroMan
Reviews.Content: Location location location... Staying here on West 71st Street means you're in one of NYC's most desirable residential neighborhoods, and not stuffed into Times Square with the tourists, paying twice the money. Central Park is a fabulous city park, with everything to offer, and from the front door of this Comfort Inn you're only a minute or two walk away from a convenient entrance to the park near the famous Dakota apartment building on 72nd Street, and the Strawberry Fields area. Even as a business traveler I enjoyed walking across the park on a sunny February morning, to catch the #6 subway over on the opposite side of the park for a ride downtown. (Of course, convenient bus and subway lines are available without walking across the park, too, but the weather was just too good not to take advantage!) Being here on the upper west side, also means that you have limitless choices for restaurants, movie theaters, museums, and so on. New Yorkers love living in this neighborhood for lots of reasons. As for the hotel itself, it was fine for NYC and especially for the price of about $130 including tax (for a single person). The queensize bed was hugely comfortable, and the WiFi, TV and everything was perfectly fine. The decor was a little dreary, and the wallpaper was a bit dark and scratched up. But this did not disturb my sleep. :-)

Reviews.Title: “nice place small room”
Reviews.Author: Jan H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff good location and good price, but very small room, room very hot not able to control the heat, but would stay again nice free breakfast , vending machine out of water each night we stayed

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter j
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Comfort Inn between 13th and 17th Feb and overall enjoyed the experience. The staff are very friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to assist you. The rooms are small but contrary to other reviews mine was very clean and tidy and besides, if you go to NY to stay in your room, you're doing something wrong. The breakfast room is small but the food is perfectly acceptable and plentiful. Again, contrary to other reviews there is a lot more on offer than toast and muffins, there is also fresh fruit, cereal, yoghurt, omlette, sausage, fresh fruit juice, muffins and doughnuts as well as an endless supply of coffee. The location is 10/10, literally a stones throw from Central Park, 20/25 min walk to Times Square and surrounded by good restaurants, basically its out of the madness but easily accessible. Overall its not the Ritz but a really good base to explore New York at a reasonable rate. I would recommend it. more on offer than toas

Reviews.Title: “Ok, average”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: Not beautiful, not even cheap. Good location, but tiny and dated

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, But Seen Better”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: I stayed in CICPW in November 2011 for roughly one week (split by spending a couple of days in Washington DC). My biggest compliment goes to the staff, who are very cheery and helpful, and I often had a great conversation with them after heading back from a day of touring and a good dinner. The rooms are OK, but they are relatively small. I got two separate rooms due to splitting the duration of the stay, and the first room was better than the second one. However, I didn't travel to NYC to spend my time in hotel rooms, so I slept, looked at some emails, washed, had breakfast, then went out for the day, so CICPW served it's purpose. The wifi is quite strong throughout the hotel, and my phone & laptop didn't have any outages that I recall when in wifi range. The location is pretty good - about 2-3 minutes walk from the 72nd St Subway stop. The breakfast is a buffet, not something I am a fan of, so I stuck to packeted cereal and juice. I prefer they offer you the meal with the room, but you can pick from a menu what you want and the chef prepares it. Overall, I would say that I would consider staying at CICPW again when I return to NYC, although I might be tempted to spend a little more money per night for something a little bit more spacious & luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Pay Me to Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly C
Reviews.Content: The hotel felt old, very narrow, and very small(even the elevator). I booked a room online that was supposed to be a smoking room. The room wound up being a non-smoking room, which wasn't so bad, until we opened the door to the room. The room was extremely small. The entire room was a king size bed, a small table, and an EXTREMELY SMALL BATHROOM. The carpeting was ripped in places and looked dirty. The bedspread was an old blanket. The bed had five pillows that were supposed to be white. Two of them looked yellow. The room was hot. We turned on the air conditioner and it never cooled the room. Our TV was broken so we couldn't use the channel guide, nor select a movie from pay-per-view. The hotel promised a "hot breakfast" which consisted of white bread and untoasted english muffins which you had to toast yourself and waffle mix. ? The kitchen or "cafe" was small, cramped, and dirty. I have NEVER written a bad review in my life but hope this will help at least one person decide NOT to book this hotel. The location was nice and that is what you're paying your money for - nothing else! The online advertisement boasts a "European" style hotel. If that's what most hotels are like in Europe, then I never want to visit! I beg you not to pay anything for this hotel and consider booking elsewhere and taking a cab to get to your next day destination! The Comfort-Inn franchaise should be embarrassed of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ponygirlpibblelady
Reviews.Content: This is a great option as long as you don't plan to spend much time in the room. Rooms were very small, only one elevator (small too). But the location is fantastic!!! Quiet street, beautiful brownstone homes all around, Central Park is a stones throw away, there is a subway stop at the end of the block, plenty of good restaurants nearby, and a short walk from the American Museum of Natural History.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: swfty
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Comfort Inn at the beginning of January for our first trip to New York. We booked through a 3rd party website and paid in advance which the man on reception knew as soon as I gave my name. Check in was friendly and efficient and we were at our room within 10 minutes. There is only one lift in the hotel which can take a while however as we only on the 5th floor it wasn't too bad. We booked a Queen Room which, having read reviews before hand, we knew wasn't going to be huge. Yet despite the size it was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was free in the morning and wasn't amazing, just a basic continental selection. The breakfast room is also very small and you can find yourself waiting a while for a table if you get there at the wrong time. The hotel is perfectly located with most of the major NY sites being within walking distance. Central Park is right across the street and, if you plan on going father afield, there are 2 subway stations very close to the hotel. One thing that does let the hotel down is the WiFi. We were told upon check in that WiFi was available for free through out the hotel however the signal is so weak that the only place you can log on is in the reception area - not very practical. If you're visiting NY on a budget and want to spend more time outside visiting all the sights rather than in the hotel then Comfort Inn is perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Dated but Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: p_canberra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over New Years for 5 nights out of our 10 night stay in New York. Prior to staying here we stayed at a hotel in the Flatiron area so this was quite different. The hotel is in an excellent quite location! You are on the same block as a subway station and at the end of the block on Columbus ave I think it is there are alot of really nice restaurants. The place was really spacious and generally quiet and the staff very helpful and friendly. There is only one lift but we didn't have any trouble with it at all, we were on the 4th floor though, so sometimes we just walked down instead. I read alot of reviews on this place before I booked - because of the concerns of the room sizes I ended up booking a king room instead of queen because of other peoples rooms, but our room was spacious and secure and we had plenty of space. The hotel is extremely dated - I think the bedding could easily be updated and I think they could offer alot more tv channels, we could also hear the plumbing from the toilet through the wall. That is my only negatives though. I would definitely be happy to stay here again and I would definitely recommend this place to others!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, GREAT location.”
Reviews.Author: MrsSantangelo
Reviews.Content: I havent been to NYC in a LONG time, and have never stayed at a hotel there. So it was VERY hard to find a place to stay that was cheap and didn't make me nervous! I was staying with my husband and my aunt, so we got the room with 1 single and 1 double. Since we were there to tour the city, we only needed the room for sleep anyways, and from what i understand, all the hotels are small anyways, we didnt need a lot of space. We checked in early, with no problems, the room was clean and ready. We tore the room apart on a bed bug check, we found no bed bugs. Elevator worked perfectly. No problems. Breakfast offered a pretty decent selection for a "small" breakfast. waffles, yogurt, sausage, fruit. several subways within a VERY short walking distance. you can practically spit on central park from the hotel. very cute, quiet street. i dont think i heard any noise while we were in our room. after a discount i have, we spent about $100 a night. to stay in central park west! i WILL stay at this hotel again, no question. i would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small room”
Reviews.Author: gustavocortereal
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, but the rooms are very, very small. If you're looking just for a place to have a shower and a bed that would be perfect, but if you need some space, like traveling with kids, forget about it. The breakfast was great, though. The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you get a bargain”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedJungleMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there couple times in the past mainly due to location (very good !). This time was the worse, very noisy, thin walls, work in progress (or noisy neighbors), takes 15 mins on average to go up/go down from room in the morning as staff uses the elevator for cleaning. I got a good deal so can't complain but usually this hotel charges $200-$250/night this is when you want to also look at other options. Reception is helpful and trying to help but limited to what they can as far as facility, noise etc. Would consider staying again only if price justifies ($120-$150/night)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Spencer M
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC we were budget minded. Our travel agent found us this hotel midway up the west side of Central Park. Rooms, of course, are small, but clean. Staff was very friendly. Great location. Many nice restaurants within short walking distance. Subway was a block away. Gives you a real feel for New York City. Situated in amongst brown stone homes and apartments. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “ticks all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: nayster
Reviews.Content: Good: Location - subway just a block away, central park at the end of the street, 30 walk to city centre, restaurants, shops and sight seeing bus routes within 2 blocks. wonderful! building: clean, modernised, tidy, easy to find your way around and easy for taxi/shuttle to find room: king size room was great size, comfy bed, heaps of pillows, windows on three sides, good clean bathroom with great shower, coffee machine in room, good cupboard and drawers for clothes and good heater breakfast: great assortment of hot and cold options, coffee and tea available all day for guests for free staff: reception staff were excellent. Especially Thomas! He really knows his stuff and was helpful with all things local including places to see, eat, walk, transport. Other staff were always friendly, helpful and chatty. House keeping did a great job and we always returned to a clean, tidy and impressive room. Food staff happy and helpful when needed every morning. Internet: free and good speed in your room Snacks: good variety of vending machines in the hotel and ice machine Luggage room: locked up free luggage room Bad: only two things. The breakfast room has seating for about 25-30 guests at one time so have to wait for a seat in busy times. Go early at 7am or late at 930am if you don't want to wait 5 minutes. The heater/radiator seemed very loud. Not enough to wake you up at night but enough to annoy you when you're watching tv. Great value, location and overall a very happy. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The bed bugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: Xxkelixx
Reviews.Content: First impression weren't great, small is an understatement! Our room was on the 12th floor and with only 1 small lift it did cause a few long waits of up to 10 mins. The room it's self was "ok", carpet was dirty and decor was dated. My main concern were the bed bugs, I was bitten quite a few times. Having checked the bed the first night we must have missed the bugger! I personally wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone unless you don't mind sharing your bed with bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Needs lots of work”
Reviews.Author: mss289r
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the staff is welcoming and friendly. The property is in need of refurbishment. The room was small (expected) but dingy and worn. Carpeting, linens, etc were clean. In general, I would say that that the hotel needs to invest some money in upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrionsBelt12345
Reviews.Content: Our family had a very nice stay at this hotel. We picked it for its location, near the ABC studios where Regis Philbin has his show. It was inexpensive, compared to most NYC hotels. The room was clean, and our experience was altogether very satisfactory. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “small, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Aim_8
Reviews.Content: Tiny place. Just room for a "full" size bed, and about 18" on each side. Even finding a place to store a single suitcase was problematic. Smallest hotel room I have seen. That said, the place was clean, safe, and in a good area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: PPForever
Reviews.Content: Good first impressions at reception, staff efficient and friendly. Had upgraded to a queen room and initially disappointed as the room was tiny and in need of a revamp was clean and tidy. Lift was very slow, but manageable. Our room had all we needed - tv, coffee maker, safe, hair dryer, phone, iron. Breakfast had good variety including waffles, muffins, toast yoghurts, fruit, eggs and sausages and tea and coffee were available at all times. Most of The staff were lovely, especially josh who could not do enough to help. However the older gentleman who worked mornings not very helpful The hotel was in a nice safe area with plenty of shops and restaurants - big nicks diner on same street was amazing value, Italian opposite Nicks not so good value. Central park was a minutes walk and Subway around the corner. Great value for money and excellent location, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JulieR20
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel first impressions were good, the reception was very clean and well maintained, polina checked us in who I must say was very helpful through out our stay. Our room was on the 9th floor so we used the lift on a regular basis, which in previous reviews was stated as very slow, we never found this an issue at all. The room we got was clean and tidy the bathroom was spotless, there was a tv, coffee maker, safe, hair dryer, phone, iron, yes the room was tiny as stated before but really this wasn't a massive issue to us. Breakfast was good waffles, muffins, toast yoghurts, fruit and eggs sausages were avaliable. The breakfast room was busy at various times between 7-9 we only waited a short time or a table though, coffee and tea was available at all times to help yourself to. The area around the hotel was safe with plenty of shops and restaurants and of course central park was a 2 minute walk away. I would stay here again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Small but not expensive”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglanTraveler115
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in NYC. This hotel is located right next to Central Park and is ideally situated for exploring the city. The total bill for a room for 3 was $362.74 for the weekend. The room was miniscule but comfortable. Watch out for the parking. The fee is $37.00 per night plus tax. If you have a dispute about the fees the garage charges you, the hotel will not help you. That happened to me. The garage wanted $100.00 for two nights and I had a terrible time getting that adjusted. The hotel was of no help at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Bolduc54
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 22 to 29 October, 2011. Pros: Location,price, and included breakfast. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Cons: Bed bug bites appeared after second night in room 305. Received more than 95 bites. Captured two live and one dead. Wife not bitten at all. Upgraded to another room. However repeated banging noise in the room. Several items unavailable at breakfast on Saturday morning.

Reviews.Title: “comfort hotel”
Reviews.Author: inky19
Reviews.Content: My husband had to be at Columbia Pres at 6:30 am for a procedure so we were just looking for a place to stay overnight. The comfort hotel served that purpose. The room was small but clean. Didn't have time to check out buffet breakfast or gym. If you want a relatively inexpensive place near Central Park with minimal amenities this might work

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: cazarooni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap, especially for the location, so don't expect it to be perfect. It doesn't ever claim to be. Buffet breakfast is good, lots of choice but small dining area so go down early. Rooms are small but ok for getting head down after a busy day. Quiet neighbourhood, close to central park and main town only 10-15 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel ok if siteseeing only - not good for a romantic break!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaS1977
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Central Park. Easy enough to get down to 5th Avenue etc. Rooms tiny. We went for a double with an extra single as I am pregnant, thank goodness we did - double bed pushed against the wall and my bump touched the other wall as I got down the side of the bed! Good to have the spare bed, which was in a different bit of the room. Tiny bathroom, could practically sit on the loo and have a shower at the same time!! Cleanliness not brilliant. Second day still doing our room at 3pm, third day we came back at 5pm having left before noon and it hadn't been done at all - they were fairly quick in bringing fresh towels when I called down to reception (towels not even bath towel size). Non smoking room, smelt of stale smoke. Breakfast was good, but get down early to get a table, they didn't run out of food at all, continuously restocking which was very good. Reception staff helpful and polite. Private cab ordered to take us back to airport, thank goodness we did, he was early by half an hour - really bad backlog on roads and he knew back routes, there is no way that we would have got to the airport had we gone in a yellow taxi! All in all, good location, but tiny rooms - good if you are in and out siteseeing etc, but not if you are going for a romantic break!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: travelmissy4747
Reviews.Content: We love this neighborhood, but the location is the only positive for this hotel. At check in time all the trash and dirty linen was piled up outside the elevator on our floor. Room was tiny-you could only walk on one side of the queen bed! Water temperature hard to regulate. Metal wall unit very dysfunctional and added to the ugly decor. No drawers, or floor space for the suitcases. Bedspread had a hole and scorch mark. Breakfast -frozen circular egg patties, junk high sugar cereals, institutional bread and donuts, etc. My opinion of the Comfort Inn chain has plummeted!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, 250 Feet From Central Park!!”
Reviews.Author: oaklawnite
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews after booking the hotel on hotwire, and I have to say I was nervous. Saying the rooms are small is an understatement, but for $133 on a weekend and about 250 feet from Central Park I don't see how anyone could complain. Our friends paid over $400 per night for a hotel about 8 blocks further away from the park and they spent as little time in their room as we did. The breakfast was average for a comfort inn, the staff was friendly and helpful, the cleanliness was acceptable, no sign of bed bugs and while the elevator could take a few minutes it never got stuck and was better than walking up 6 flights of stairs. One recommendation is to ask for a room with two beds. The front desk clerk recommended it, although we are married he said it had more room, and he was right. The shower was roomier than expected and had a nice waterpik shower head. The bathroom was the size of an average linen closet, but it worked for us. The "horror" stories are obviously from people who thought that $133 per night would get them a room comparable to a $700 room at The Plaza. Go in expecting the local airport Comfort Inn and I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small, bed bug”
Reviews.Author: alter_idem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of September and on the very last day found a bed bug on the bed. So we went through all the precautions to make sure that if we did bring any home that we would not get an infestation (ie. garbage bagging our luggage and washing everything we got, as well as freezing delicates). Haven't seen anything yet so *fingers crossed*. However, have noticed several bites in the "breakfast, lunch, dinner" pattern on one side of my body. But since bites can appear up to 9 days after, hoping that it was from the trip. My husband have not gotten any bites so far. Checked the bed and drawers the night we got there were no signs of infestation. However, did find needle caps in one of the drawers. Told front desk and they cleaned it up but there was no apologies. As for the size, it is very small. You know its small when only one person can be in the bathroom at one time. Also when my husband checked our bed, it looked like one of the beams was broken, this made for an uncomfortable sleep. Have stayed at Comfort Inns in NYC before and expected a lot more. Next time I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: manali1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice budget hotel, the rooms are clean but small. The location is great! The breakfast is very filling and tastes good.

Reviews.Title: “OK property. Beware of smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: It was an OK property. Decent price, but not a bargain. Around USD 200.00 per night for a queen bed room. Small rooms, but quiet. No street noise. Quiet street. Lot's of dining options nearby and close to the 8th Ave and 7th Ave subway lines. Decor is definitely dated. Safe and relatively clean (no weird stains or critters crawling about, at least as of 09/27/11). Beware that this property allows smoking in specific rooms and does not guarantee that you will have a room that smells fresh. Even rooms that are designated non-smoking still wreak of smoke. I'm a former smoker so it was very annoying to me. Especially here in the US where smoking indoors has effectively been banned.

Reviews.Title: “Too small to mention”
Reviews.Author: terryulsterman
Reviews.Content: If you like your room to be so small you need to step outside to change your mind then this is the place for you. If not then take a tip and go elsewhere. In addition to the rooms being small they are old, dirty and very badly appointed. Breakfast will be included on most deals but be prepared for paper plates, plastic utensils and no room to sit down. On a positive the location is excellent and staff are OK.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my!”
Reviews.Author: Hortense9
Reviews.Content: The dirty front windows should have been a clue. The only thing I can say good is that they do have a big breakfast that is included in the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Bad, and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: The Good: Only a block from Central Park and within walking distance of Museum of Natural History Quiet Charming Street and right around the corner from The Dakota (John Lennon's Home) Lots of restaurants within 2 blocks (PINK BERRY!) The Bad: Smallest room I've ever had in any hotel. Even for NYC this was small. Claustraphobic lobby and breakfast room The UGLY: 9-10 angry red bites on my upper body showed up msyteriously after staying here. I would not stay here again, even though the location was perfect for vistiing my friends who live a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Couple Location”
Reviews.Author: Wildcat82
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent September 9-12, 2011, at this hotel. The 9/11 10th Anniversary weekend. Found this location on a previous trip to NYC and decided to look into staying there for this trip, due to its location. Bottom line, I highly recommend this hotel for a couple or family with one-two teenage child who need a place to sleep and bath, while seeing the city. The breakfast is good and plentiful to start the day, facility is clean, and staff is friendly. Neighborhood is quiet and safe. Local shopping and restaurants are a block away. Buses and Subway a block in either direction. Central Park a block away. Rates vary based upon many factors, so check web site and use all your options but published rates still reasonable to others in same location. If money isn't an issue and room size is, may want to look elsewhere. As any review for any hotel in Manhattan will state, rooms in NYC are going to be smaller than you may have experienced elsewhere. If you are visiting the city for a short stay, have friends in this area and need a place to stay, or you are traveling with no more than one-two other adults or teens, then I saw no reason you would not be comfortable. We had a King room, with table, two chairs, refrigerator, coffee maker, TV, closet, and bath. Again, all satisfactory, serviceable, and clean. Was able to see into some of the other rooms and they didn't offer as much, but enough to be comfortable. If you don't consider yourself a high maintenance person and understand you will only be in your room to sleep an cleanup, then this location is as good, quiet, safe, and convienient as any you could want in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel and good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: Binajack
Reviews.Content: I booked a queen room online via the Comfort Inn website six months prior to my stay (keep this in mind for later on in my story) which was Sept 3-5, 2011. Check in went smoothly and the gentleman at the front desk (I don't recall his name) was very friendly and helpful. I knew that the room would be small (based on many reviews that I had read) so when we got up to our room and it was TINY I wasn't surprised. It was clean and suited our needs well enough however the bed seemed like a really, really small queen. The next day we were looking at a map of the hotel and noticed that our room was actually a double....so I went down to the front desk to ask what type of room we were given. The nice man (same one as before) at the front desk said that we had a double. I quickly pulled out the printed copy of my reservation which showed a queen room. He said "the price on there isn't a queen room but a lower cost double" We went back and forth for a bit and eventually he said that they had a software change over the summer and that could have caused the problem and that I should talk to the assistant manager in the morning when I checked out. So, the next morning when I was checking out I spoke with the manager and after a bit of a discussion she lowered the rate of our room by $10 a night. I was happy enough with that to come back and stay there again....although next time I will confirm when I check in that the room I'm getting is the room type I reserved. Breakfast was good and plentiful however the layout is really weird and people were bumping into each other. My husband had a waffle one morning and enjoyed it a lot and the eggs and sausage/bacon were good too. There were comments about a noisy a/c unit and that is a true story for us (we had room 306) as well. Overall I will stay here again, the neighborhood is AWESOME. Mostly residential lined with trees and old brownstones but at the end of the block is Columbus Ave where there are lots of restaurants and shops. The best part for us was that Central Park was 1/2 block away, along with the subway station, bus stop and 2 blocks away was a stop for the "hop on/hop off" big red bus.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth of money!”
Reviews.Author: MHTE
Reviews.Content: As a European point of view: very friendly and cozy hotel with a great service and location! Small but very clean rooms, comfortable beds and - most important of all - powerful AC system :) Peaceful neighbourhood, good subway connections. Breakfast much better and more variable than we could even expect. Very friendly and helpful staff, great service (especially greetings to ladies and Thomas in the reception). Definitely no need to think where we're going to stay next time visiting NYC. PS: for great pizzas and hamburger-meals, try "Big Nick's" at the same street towards Broadway. Really enjoyed our stay, Thank you!! M & H & T & E, Finland.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, convenient and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Calyponte
Reviews.Content: 71st between Columbus Ave and Central Park West, just around the corner from the Dakota building. Absolutely amazing location. Quiet, family neighbourhood and only a couple of subway stations away, or less than $ 10 cab ride to Times Square, half a block from central park. Amazing restaurants down Columbus Ave, just a beautiful area of town. Subway stations all around within a 5 minute walk. The rooms were “European style”, quite small, but if you’re in New York on vacation, you only use it to sleep, shower and go so it worked great for us.. Rates were very reasonable, with breakfast included and WiFi as well, so you can’t go wrong. Staff was amazing too. And best of all, its’ hurricane proof! We were there during Irene and we slept through it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mpars023
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. It was clean, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was ample and well stocked. There were no signs of bugs (bed bugs, roaches or otherwise). I would completely recommend staying here if you are looking for a hotel that is affordable and near to the center of the city. There is a subway stop one block away and it was less than 10 minutes to subway into the downtown. We even walked up from Time Square which was a quick and easy walk. The only downside was that the room was small but not uncomfortably so as long as you don't have a phenomenal amount of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel, it'svalue your money!”
Reviews.Author: danielacajiao
Reviews.Content: It is very good located, near everything, you can walk all around until late in the night. The metro station is just one block far -on W72-. Al least two bus routes. The price is really good, people really kind and aware of your safety. You can have buffete hot breakfast!. A really nice place, nice people, so clean, well located!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with tiny room”
Reviews.Author: MegAyal
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. You're a block from the subway, a 1/2 block from Central Park and there are many good restaurants nearby. The hotel is sqeezed in between residential brownstones so it's very quiet. We were on 2nd floor and had no noise issues. Staff was friendly and attentive. Breakfast is a nice bonus. Ok..now for the not so great qualities. Rooms are tiny, bathrooms are really tiny. Think inside cruise ship tiny. Beds are comfortable but saggy. Hot water was unreliable. Tv worked sometimes. Staff was responsive & friendly though. Room was clean. It's an old building in a great area. Would stay again even with hot water issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: truckstopblues
Reviews.Content: Small but comfortable rooms, great breakfast, helpful staff and superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have been more happy!”
Reviews.Author: minurse
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here July 9th thru 14th. It was an extremely hot week, our rooms airconditioner was excellent! We stayed in a King Bed room. There was plenty of room and was well worth the upgrade that I paid for. Our room was clean and neat. No site of bed bugs (and I looked). The bathroom was of sufficient size and met all our needs, shower was excellent. The staff at the front desk were so friendly and helpful at all times to us and to other patrons. We had a small issue with our toilet and maintenance was up there and fixed the issue before we finished with breakfast! Speaking of breakfast... SAVE $$$ and eat their continental breakfast every morning! You will pay $20-$30 to get the same offerings that they have there! Excellent variety, eggs, sausage, bacon, fresh fruit, yogurt, fruit cups, cereals, toasts, bagels, doughnuts fresh made Belgian waffles and plenty of juice choices, milk and coffee's! The hallways are very small, the elevator even smaller! Have some patience, spend your time enjoying the amazing city and rest your head here! I would return to this amazing location in a heartbeat! EVERYTHING is so accessable from this starting point! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Small room but excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: rememberfromelles
Reviews.Content: My senior parents & I shared a room for 4 nights - 1 double bed, 1 single. The room was very small, but this is New York, and we were literally only there to sleep. Breakfast is included in the tariff in a small room at ground level, with plenty of variety and it was constantly being re-stocked. The hotel is in a quiet street half a block from Central Park, an easy walk across the park to the Met, half a block from the ACE (blue) metro line 72nd station and a block and a half from the 123 (red) metro line 72nd station (which has a lift) - very convenient for public transport to the city sights. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for the best price on the UWS”
Reviews.Author: Youthvol
Reviews.Content: Every summer, my mid 20 year old daughter and I join 10 other women on a girl's trip - staying in a brownstone in Harlem. This year, my late 20 year old son joined us 4 days prior to the rest of the ladies arrival. Wanting a hotel in a new and different location (and wanting to add some type of reward points to my credit), we chose the Comfort Inn on the UWS. Walking a half block east and a half block north - you are at Strawberry Fields in Central Park (which is the same distance to the A, C, B and D trains). Just a couple of blocks to the west, you are at the 1,2 and 3 trains. Columbus Ave has so many things to offer in just a few blocks distance (Shake Shack, Starbucks, Pinkberry) so you'll be pleased with food choices. Although the room was small (much smaller than expected), we were pleased with the care and attention. The view of the inside of the property was dark/always looked overcast, and the window a/c unit only cooled 1/2 of the room until we settled in, but other than that - I feel we got our money's worth. I had been checking online for several weeks for the best price and even when I called to add one day to the front of the visit, they gave me the same "cheap" price. The front desk clerks were very helpful - and knowledgeable. They called for a car service when we needed one, and the check out procedure was only a minute or 2. When we travel to NYC (once or twice a year), we don't go for the bed/bath/view. (By the way, there was no tub in our room - only a shower.) We go for a clean and safe room. The room at the Comfort Inn was very clean, and very safe. The breakfast room was small, but again - with so many options of places to eat in NYC, why would you eat in the hotel? We grabbed a small box of cereal to go and were thrilled it was something to snack on until we found the perfect new place to try for lunch. Again, check around for prices and you will be happy you picked this location. Oh, and if you are right next to the elevator - you luck out with a separate twin bed! BONUS! Will definitely keep this hotel on my top 5 list of places to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in upscale neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AZMomto3
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is superb. Located next to Central Park in Manhattan on West side-tucked away in an upscale neighborhood. We had a King room, which was very large for NY. The hotel was very clean and hotel staff excellent. Any questions you have, they were able to answer or look up online for us. Hotel includes a hot breakfast which is hard to come by for most hotels. The A/C worked great, no issues with water or leaking. We requested a refrigerator, and at no additional charge, they brought it right up to our room! Wonderful visit! Will definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, though basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: delimak82
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in prime location. Few minutes away from 2 different subway stations, and couple of minutes walk from Central Park. Staff at hotel were fantastic, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good with decent variety though breakfast room is quite small, and had to take my breakfast back to my room to eat a couple of times, so get there early! Room was very small and basic, with noisy heating system throughout the night, with no view apart from a brickwall. Next time will probably try and stay somewhere else, primarily due to issues with the room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: myi4u
Reviews.Content: As stated above, it's one of the worst hotels. Bed bugs were very true. I don't mind if it's a tiny room but it's dirty! The lift was a bit of a disaster too. One small lift and if the cleaners were cleaning the rooms, you will only have one option which is to use the staircase. On the other hand, breakfast was good. Not a good night sleep though. Service was average. Free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location and Breakfast!! :) :)”
Reviews.Author: Angelica_8891
Reviews.Content: initially, we werent expecting much - and the outside really doesn't do it Justice, it's kind of hidden, we walked past it a couple of times during our stay. we stayed for 7 nights during July 4th in a double room on the 3rd floor - (lucky for us as we could climb the stairs) the rooms are not as small as i thought they'd be, perfect size for 2 people sharing, rooms and bathroom were also kept very clean - great maids, provided us with fresh towels, clean sheets and replaced shampoos and soap each morning. you also get an Iron, ironing board, WIFI, TV and a Safe to keep your valuables in (a charge $1.50/day for using it, although we didnt get charged), which makes you feel a bit more secure about leaving your passports and valuables behind. the breakfast is served 7-10am, and worth waking up for !- great variety and the staff constantly re-fill anything that runs out. mmmhhm Yum! (there is also a "Gym" downstairs, its basically a small room with two equipments, but dont let this put you off...who really exercises on Holiday?!! no-one used it the whole time we were there.) the Location is perfect!!, right near cenral park and there is a subway on the next street and a another few blocks away... its far enough from the busy, chaos and noise of Times Square but close enough by subway. lastly, the staff were soo nice and helpful, (always greet you when you leave and come back) especially Thomas, very helpful! highly recommend this hotel and would definitely go back!! Love NYC P.S... Mattress very very comfortable - had great sleep every night

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Nennet
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a five night stay at the hotel and I really wouldn't recommend trying it. We pre-booked a room for 3 people, non smoking with easy accesibility as one party was elderly and di not walk well. We called to confirm and found they had given us a smoking room, as an asthmatic not possible. They then said they would 'upgrade' us for free instead. When we got there they had 2 bookings for us, one for the smoking room and one for the upgrade, The upgrade consisted of a 12th floor room with a King size bed and a foldaway bed that you had to leave in the hallway when not using as there wasn;t any room for it in the room. We ended up having to move all the furniture around, which they refused to help us do at the hotel, and play a Tetris game each daye with the bed, our cases and a massive black leather chair which we wanted removed, again they wouldn;t do. I did check out the smoking room which stank of smoke and had a single and 'double' bed - the double would not have fitted 2 people as was tiny. The hotel only has one very slow lift so at times we waited downstairs for 10-15 minutes to get up to the 12th floor. I ended up walking down when on my own as was quicker. Breakfast was miserable in a tiny room with rubbish chairs and not enough room for more than 15 people at a time. The food was not very exciting and I didn;t bother after the first day, instead going out to Starbucks round the corner. The bathroom was minute with a child sized bath, they provided shampoo but no shower gel(?) The toilet flooded in the middle of the night on 2 different occassions and they did come and unblock it right away but still shouldn't have occured. Wi-fi was free but didn;t work everywhere in our room so had to sit in a corner to use it. The only good thing was the location which was amazing. Upper West side is great, there's a subway right next door and another 2 blocks away as well as the Park being right next to the hotel. Would deffinately recommend any hotel around the 70's or 80's in Upper West Side but wish we hadn't wasted the money on this one as was a very costly experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantAAAstic staff. Location excellent!”
Reviews.Author: CraigHGraham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel and found the best staff anywhere, especially William! The WiFi was not working really well on the 11th floor so we spent quite a bit of time in the foyer doing our surfing. I witnessed a couple customers explaining some problems and one lady was quite upset. William spoke to her at length, showed compassion and empathy with her problems and sorted everything out for her. This guy should be paid more!!! Back to the hotel... the room we stayed in (1101) was tiny, but we had expected that, it's New York. The room was clean and the housekeeping was excellent. A good breakfast is provided each morning too.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marianne215123
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night at this hotel which I booked through CheapOair. The hotel told me to cancel reservation as they can offer me a better rate which I did. They charged me for the room upon checking out and didn't want to refund the amount paid through CheapOair so they charged me twice. I never had such a bad experience. The staff said they will refund me first thing in the morning and was extremely unprofessional. I asked why cannot they apply the fee that they charged the vendor which they rejected meaning they wanted to double charge me. If you would like to be ripped off, then you will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: klee1950
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quiet, staff was always friendly. Great area to relax after site-seeing. Room was small but adequate. I have seen much smaller rooms for more money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise1957_11
Reviews.Content: My brother & I have just returned from 6 days staying at the Comfort Inn Central Park West and what a fantastic hotel this is. Located in the Upper West Side a lovely quiet residential area, 2 mins from Central Park around the corner from the famous Dakota Building as well as 2 mins from Columbus Ave where there are some great priced restaurants. A 5 min walk to Broadway St and the subway as well as more restaurants. So close to all major attractions and shopping as well as on the Gray Line Hop On Hop off Bus route. Absolutely fantastic staff a credit to the Comfort Inn Chain, always willing to help and offer suggestions. Rooms quite small but adequate and always clean with plenty of linen. Breakfast was wonderful plenty of choice andand continously replenished as well as lovely and clean. Will definately recommend this Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Cntral location”
Reviews.Author: FastCarLisbon
Reviews.Content: This was a "Mystery hotel" offered by Expedia. (Only knew the area and stars before I paid) Only 80$/Night. One Queen nonsmoking Included: Continental Breakfast, Free Wireless Internet. Breakfast on plastic plates OK for that price. V. Small room, but quit area. Even found free street parking in the snowstorm...

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid accommodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JoeCooper
Reviews.Content: It upsets me to read reviews by people who are entirely negative about a hotel. I think i can also say i've never been entirely positive about a hotel either. Everywhere you stay you'll find the good and the bad. The rooms in this hotel are small, but the hotel is in New York City - one of the most densely populated places in the world. It's also in one of the most vibrant cities in the world, so i can't imagine why you'd be spending a large amount of time in the room. The rooms are small, with no fridge, but with free wi-fi and, in our case, an oddly positioned television. The bathrooms are also snug and the major complaint has to be the muted glass wall that separates the bathroom from the rest of the well, offering very little privacy. There is, to be honest, not a lot of room left after you bring in your suitcases and yourselves. But if you're sensible and arrange everything to suit, you can get by. But the room isn't everything. The service is great. The desk staff were friendly and accommodating (especially after we locked the key in the room) and the people looking after the breakfast area certainly did their best to make everyone comfortable. The included breakfast has a good, standard assortment and probably the best possible considering the cosy dining room. There are only a half-dozen tables and it can be a struggle for space, but everyone makes-do with the assistance of the staff. It's not glamorous, but i don't think any reasonable person can complain when offered cereals, waffles, toast, bagels, pastries, fruit, yoghurt and more, with no limit. Everyone wants to be in a nice, safe neighbourhood with easy access to the city and that's probably what this is. It's almost suburban, with 250m to trains in either direction, as well as to Central Park. You can walk to Columbus Circle, or even Times Square if you're game. I'd recommend this to anyone looking to stay on a budget and can be realistic about what to expect when staying on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghbjm
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter weekend 2011 as we were in town for a wedding. We had a king bed room with a roll-away. Though the rooms are smaller, the beds were comfortable, the room was very clean, the staff could not have been more helpful. Everything within walking distance, museums, restaurants, churches, Central Park, and cabs to to be had on either corner. We would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade your room for one of the best value stays in NY city”
Reviews.Author: Angiemach
Reviews.Content: Our standard room was way too small to contemplate doing any work in but would be fine if you literally just wanted to sleep in your room. The larger rooms were great and still offered very good value. The breakfast is included and is a 'value' affair but everything's there if you can get a place at a table. It's budget but not slumming it and with free wi-fi I found it a very affordable option for a work trip. Great location too - very near the red and blue lines for travelling around Manhattan. Dale is one of the best receptionists we have found. There is only one small lift so fitter people may prefer this than people with mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nkhula21
Reviews.Content: Unless you're so frugal that you don't mind inflicting pain on your own soul just to save a $20, if you're lucky, this is not a place to stay. We were put in a room that had a 5.5x4 feet bed. The room was so tiny that we could not even find somewhere to put shoes, let alone bags. You are probably better off keeping your shoes own, anyway, because the carpet is so filthy. The bath tab is four-feet long. I booked the hotel through hotwire.com. Hotwire does not show you the names or addresses of the hotels until you make a reservation (or is it until you make a mistake). They entice you with the prices. Once you checkout, it becomes a "God's case no appeal." You cannot change or seek refund when you finally look at the pictures or read reviews of the hotel. The television is not free. Apart from reviews, you pay for anything you watch. By the time you checkout, you will have spent the same amount of money that it costs to stay in a more decent hotel in Chelsea, midtown or lower Manhattan. The gym is just two pieces of metal meant to mislead people the hotel has a fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific NY bargain, in a killer nabe.”
Reviews.Author: eejitkerry
Reviews.Content: I stay here whenever I come to NYC. It's an amazing deal. Sure, the rooms aren't huge. Yes they're decorated in tones of brown and gold. But the rooms are clean, the location is primo, and the really friendly staff works their butts off to make it a terrific experience.... AND for under $200 a night, which is an impossible price in this city. Especially with free breakfast! I would tell everyone I know, but I am afraid that it will make it so popular that I won't be able to get reservations when I want to come. Oh yeah, and the bed was soooooo comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel all around!”
Reviews.Author: Erinluvsire
Reviews.Content: I was there for spring break March 2011, I had an amazing stay at this hotel! The staff was great, they went out of their way to make everyone feel welcome! Thomas was especially fantastic! There was also continental breakfast included. The only complaint i had was the view from my room was horrible I was looking at a brick wall. On the plus side, the room was ready at 9am. I could have waited for a better room if i wanted to. I highly recommend this hotel, will be staying here again! I booked through hotwire.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for NYC visitors on a budget”
Reviews.Author: monkton-bunkton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem in my opinion. Ok, the rooms are small and basic, BUT people need to realise that you get what you pay for. If you plan to spend that much time in your hotel room whilst in NYC, why bother going!? The rooms and facilities were clean, staff were very helpful and location superb. If you want an affordable hotel in Manhattan that isn't amongst the crazy pace of life in areas such as Times Square etc,this is the one to go for.  You will get most benefit from this hotel if you are prepared to make use of the subway. $29 gets you a 7-day unlimited metrocard and the 72nd St stop (C or B line) is hardly any distance from the hotel at all. Download the free subway app onto your iPhone and you're laughing. The free breakfast is a superb bonus, though we found that we started noticing how 'beige' all the food was after having eaten it for a week. Healthier options are available in the way of fruit, yogurt, wholemeal bread and cereal... but you WILL find yourself indulging in the waffle making machine and muffins at least once during your time there! Only one negative would be the walls in our room (not sure if it applies to all the rooms but ours was like this). It appears that when the hotel put in the air-conditioning systems (as an afterthought it would seem) they didn't seal the gaps up and as such we could feel a draft coming from the wall! In fact we could see several small holes around the aircon unit where it hadn't been filled! A quirky feature but it didn't bother us that much, especially as the mercury didn't rise that much while we were there. This wouldn't make us hesitate recommending the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roles
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the Comfort Inn and were very satisfied with the value for money. We did get a tiny room when we booked in (no room for our suitcase) and asked if we could change and were moved the next night to a larger room. And the staff (especially Suzanna were very helpful and friendly) I think we booked a Queen and were moved to a King which has a desk and room to spread out a bit. The heaters were a bit noisy as mentioned in a previous review, but once you worked out where the creaks and clicks were coming from, it was not a problem. The location had no traffic noise and we could not hear any of our neighbours. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast was generous, if a bit heavy on starch. The location is great. Quiet, but half a block from Central Park, a short walk to the subway, a hop-on hop-off stop and a huge range of restuarants. If you are on a tight budget, as we were, "Nicks Pizzas and Burgers Too" was at the end of the road and theburgers were very good. We found the wonderful Crown Deli about 10 mins away in Broadway where the yoghurt with fruit was great and the bain maries of hot foods really good value at $8 per lb. By the by - getting a New York City Pass was the best thing we did. Just under $70 each for 3 days and for that we got free entrance into all the museums and galleries, the Empire state and the full 3 hour cruise around the island. It saved us plenty.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ny2011
Reviews.Content: there were 3 of us and we were concerned about the reviews about the room sizes. when we got there the room was perfect. even though there was 3 of us, there was still enough space for our luggage and us! the location was brilliant. about a 15-20minute walk to times square. very quiet area with lots of restaurants on the next 2 avenues. breakfast was lovely. filled us up. coffee was amazing! better than starbucks!! the hotel staff were FANATSTIC! they were so helpful. organised a car to the airport, and wouldnt allow the driver to charge more than quoted. gave us advice of places to go, and were very patient when we wanted to split the hotel bill. could not fault them! the hotel was clean at all times. would recommed this to anyone looking for vaulue for money in a brilliant area of new york!

Reviews.Title: “A sordid, dispiriting mess of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler82
Reviews.Content: What can one say about a hotel which offers an indescribably small, claustrophobic shoebox of a room with little or no heat (and clanging pipes when the heat deigned to come on at 3 am in the morning), with bloodstains on the bed cover, dirty sheets, worn/stained towels, windows which are not properly sealed and which let in freezing air, fetid shower curtains, soiled carpets and tired furniture? A dispiriting experience - even for one night. Not even the location makes up for the faults. Stay anywhere else but here. A disastrous Hotwire buy on my part - got burned again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location.”
Reviews.Author: Jonesess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the room to be very clean. The continental breakfast was really nice and the staff were very approachable and always on hand to help. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location great price”
Reviews.Author: rjbrevitt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, 1 block from the Dakota building ( where John Lennon was shot), across the road from Strawberry Fields in centra Park. Very clean hotel, very helpfull staff, 15 minute walk to Times Square, it is central to everything you could need for a very enjoyable break. Eat in Big Nicks at the end of the street, great food great service. We would stay there again, clean rooms, very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kris V
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here after winning a bid on Priceline. The price for this room was fantastic considering it was a holiday weekend and it's in New York City. The room was VERY small, with very little storage space. There was no closet or desk and the bathroom was very small. As far as cleanliness, it was average at best, nothing to write home about. On a positive note, there was free Wifi and breakfast. If you are like me, looking for a hotel in the city in a great location (less than a block from Central Park, close to the Museum of Natural History) at a very reasonable price, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan0204
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great hotel, but you need to know what you are getting. As others have mentioned, the rooms are indeed very small. My room had a full size bed and dresser with a TV on top of it, but no desk, and not much floor space besides that. The bathroom was also quite small, though similar in size to bathrooms in European hotels I've stayed at. However, in all other respects this is a great hotel. My room on the 2nd floor was quiet and the bed was very comfortable (pillowtop mattress). The room was clean and bedbug-free. There are a number of good included perks - breakfast was good (free waffle machine, Tropicana orange juice, etc.), wi-fi was fast and free, and you even get a free daily copy of the Wall Street Journal (first hotel I have seen this at - not even W, JW Marriott or Le Meridien where I have stayed in the past did this). Staff were uniformly very polite. And location is fantastic. The hotel is half a block from Central Park and it was a joy to go running there in the morning. Best of all is the price - I got a $64/night rate on Hotwire, which I thought was a steal given the location, cleanliness and perks. I'm not sure I would pay full price for this hotel, but if you can get a good deal through Hotwire or elsewhere, I completely recommend this place - just know what you are getting for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a great location”
Reviews.Author: amcarraher1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location- close to 2 subway stations and Central Park, and the staff was extremely friendly. Some previous reviews mentioned bed bugs, but our stay was bed bug free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: halfpint6799
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Room was very small but I didn't mind at all. Very clean, carpet looked somewhat new, bathroom looked new as well. Staff was the nicest I have ever experienced and I have traveled a lot. Was only in town to see Regis and Kelly and this was only four blocks from their studio. I will definately stay here again. Oh yes, heating was by space heater but again no problem with that. My room was very quiet as well, with minimal street noise. Only the occassional fire truck. Room #908

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in West Central Park...”
Reviews.Author: Poorgourmet
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, with 2 Subway Train Stations nearby (less than a block away) and another just a short walking distance away...If you use the Subway train at night you feel safe due to the proximity of the hotel to the stations... They offer a great complimentary continental breakfast which has plenty of options although the breakfast room is crowded as it is very small... The price is very reasonable...a small but cozy hotel...extra friendly staff always available to go the extra mile for the guest....

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, at all!”
Reviews.Author: littleJ89
Reviews.Content: So after reading tons and tons of reviews on New York hotels i thought i was risk booking this one, after all i figured when in Manhattan you'll spend most of your time in the city and use the hotel to sleep. This hotel was perfect for me and my friend, we stayed over the New Year and found no complaints. We're both no taller than 5ft 2, so room size, bathroom size etc was no problem for us, infact nothing was "too small/cramped" or what have you. The view was great and the price wasn't too much (considering we are also students) neither of us found any complaints and found the staff friendly. The plus side was having a subway station only 1 block away and there were shops/cafe's/restaurants that weren't too far so food was no problem! It was also less than a 10min walk to Time Square (we're also fast walkers) so getting into the main streets and avenues was simple and quick.

Reviews.Title: “loved the place”
Reviews.Author: joejoe47
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in december, we were unaware of the size of the rooms, but were not surprised, i googled the hotel so could see the size from the outside, we were not bothered because we only slept there, we were out for most of the time anyway, thats why you go there. The location was spot on for everything, the rooms were clean and tidy, the staff were very very good we were stuck there due to weather at home they just gave us another room without question at the lower rate, and looked after us, they could have turned us away when we returned, when we do go to new york again, we will definatley return to this one, if you want to stay in manhatten then this is the place to stay. and if the staff read this i would like to say thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and tiny room, but great location”
Reviews.Author: kmak24
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking for a cheap hotel in Manhattan that was close to public transit. You get what you pay for as we paid about $60 CAD/night for a really tiny room, which measured around 8 feet by 8 feet plus a private bathroom. The double bed took up most of the floor space. The air conditioner was very loud, which made sleeping at night difficult. There was only one elevator, which was very small and extremely slow. We stayed on the 9th floor and it was faster to walk up and down the stairs, which we did. The hotel staff was friendly. The biggest strength for this hotel is its location. It is located between two subway lines (Red and Blue lines) and close to multiple bus lines as well. The hotel is situated near convenience stores and a variety of restaurants on Columbus Ave. It is also footsteps from Central Park, which let us go for a walk any time we wanted. Overall, if you're traveling on a tight budget, don't mind sleeping in a small room, and want a hotel that is close to public transit, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad about the bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Chompie
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression was quite good, having read the reviews with some trepidation. The room was very small but clean, fairly nicely decorated and well designed to maximize the very minimal space. The bed was comfortable and we did what we thought was a pretty thorough check for bed bugs. The mattress was clean and appeared new as was the bed pad and linens. The third day one of us woke up with close to 20 bites. We lifted the mattress and did find one blood laden bed bug which we squashed and put on a kleenex as evidence. The hotel moved us to another room for the final night - they were pretty casual about it and we had the impression this was pretty routine. We're not sure if there were bugs in the second room - I did have more bites the next day but we read that it could take a few days for the bites to emerge. We put all our luggage for the final night in the bathtub - assuming that this was the safest place. Since getting home we left all the luggage on our back porch - fortunately it is very cold so we're hoping any hitchhiking bugs and eggs will freeze into oblivion. As an extra precaution we are bringing stuff in from the cold and putting it in the dryer at a high temperature - since the clothes are dry, the high heat doesn't seem to affect them but we're hoping that the freeze-roast approach kills any New York bugs. The whole experience has put a real damper on our enthusiasm for New York which we normally visit at least once a year. Hotels and the city really need to get this under control because it's a real tourist turnoff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ycart096
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly pleased when staying at this Hotel recently. Although basic and rooms are small as described in previous reviews this hotel is more then sufficient for the purpose of your stay here. Its a stones throw from Central Park and walkable to Midtown and Times square. The staff are very helpful and polite. There is only 1 lift so be prepared for a wait or walk up the stairs to rooms. The rooms are again basic but clean and tidy. The beds are very comfortable and the complimentary breakfast is more then sufficient for your day ahead.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: markthompson186338
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from the comfort inn central park west on 71st street we stayed from monday the 29th until friday the 3rd. what a lovely hotel the staff are very helpful at reception was brilliant. Dale the receptionist was very helpful if you needed anything and thomas in the evening was just as helpful and the complementary breakfast there was more than enough coffee, doughnuts. muffins,waffles,and cereal overall it was a nice stay the hotel staff were very good. rooms are very clean and tidy not the biggest but big enough. the location is good about a 15 min walk to time square and its a quieter road so hardly no noise in the evening and there are enough restaurants in 72nd street to accommodate everyones taste on the whole its well worth the cost

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bedbugs bite”
Reviews.Author: Dharmaboy17
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions weren't too bad. I knew the rooms would be small but mine was fairly well equipped. The service on the front desk was fine too. However, the breakfast was one of those styrofoam affairs served up in a miniscule 'breakfast room' in which people are tripping over each other. But the real issue was the bedbugs. My body was covered in bites from which I am still recovering. Perhaps I was just unlucky...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: BenjaminLondonderry
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent. They were very helpful and friendly and dealt with any problems and enquiries that we had. They were more than happy to help out in any way that they could. Great staff provided excellent customer service. The room was clean and tidy. The curtains were a bit ropely and the room was small. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Times Square and right next to Central Park. A few roads over from Broadway and good restaurants are within 10 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we would most certainly use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: billymac1946
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews we decided to go with an open mind. We found the service to be excellent with very helpful and friendly staff. The location was absolutley ideal for the subway or a stroll in central park. Although the room was smaller than many hotels it had everything we needed with the bonus of an en suite bathroom which is hard to find in NYC for this price.We found the room very clean with maid service daily and although our room was at the front of the hotel it was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfasts were more than adequate with a good choice considering it is classed as a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Really quite nice. Just know what it is first.”
Reviews.Author: soubrettina
Reviews.Content: I know what you're thinking. "Soubrettina, why are you writing a review of a hotel...in Manhattan...and at that, a Comfort Inn? Really?" So, my mom headed to town to help me with a little project. We know each other well enough by now to know that we like each other more with distance. So, having her stay with me in my (admittedly large, but still a) studio apartment isn't ideal. Normally, she rents an apartment, but her favorite was booked. So, I went hotel searching. Everyone knows that hotels in NYC are insane. I am thrilled that, as a NYC resident, I don't have to pay for them or even think about them most times. Everything was more crazily priced than normal this time. Then I stumbled upon this Comfort Inn. We all know Comfort Inn. It's a mid-range, reasonably priced hotel. I stayed in them with the folks on many a family vacation. It's not luxury, but it's predictable. And with a AAA discount, it was about as tolerable as you'll get in NYC for four nights. And it's not a bad location either...Upper West Side, steps from Central Park and a few more to Lincoln Center, etc., near the C, B, and 1 trains, etc., etc., etc. Yes, folks have said it before. The rooms are TINY...and a half. Seriously, my college dorm rooms were bigger. The full sized bed takes up the bulk of it. However, there's a TV atop a dresser, little chair squeezed in, nightstand, and a tiny bathroom. However, it's all quite clean. And really? Who comes to NYC to spend tons of time in their hotel room? There's a free continental breakfast, tiny workout room, and the wifi is reliable. How do I know? I know because I am on the internet now in the room. I know, I know. You're asking, "Soubrettina, why are you staying in your mom's miniature hotel room?" And that leads me to the last reason why I like this place. You see, mom was supposed to stay for four nights. However, she fell, ended up in the hospital, and busted up her kneecap. And here we are with her in an immobilizer on her right knee. I'm spending the night and will be getting her to a rebooked flight out of LGA tomorrow. But wait...what about those three other nights she's supposed to stay? You see, the hotel staff here is great. They adjusted her reservation with no fine and no early checkout/change fee...no questions asked. So, if you're looking for a place in the city on a budget (Don't forget the AAA discount, if you're a member!) and don't need fancy frills (seriously), think about the old, reliable, hotel chain of your family road trips past. It's great, if you just know what it is in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: MagicDude4Eva
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience. The double-bed rooms are tiny and the room features one cupboard which is so small that one would not be able to hang up clothes for a stay longer than 3 days. One of my colleagues had bedbugs in his room and after a few days developed severe rash.

Reviews.Title: “Lucked Out”
Reviews.Author: mahaloboy
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, we lucked out. No mishaps in our two nights stay. Our rooms were less than $200/night taxes included. My biggest fear was the bed bugs previous reviews indicated. We checked our beds, found none, and slept well. We got the smallest room on the 11th floor next to the elevator and next to the door that goes to our wing. We lucked out with hardly any traffic on that floor. The room was small and the bathroom was very small. We are not big people and I can see why the room will a problem with bigger people. Bottom line, is that it was a very affordable place to stay at a great residential location next to Central Park. It was a place to sleep and not to hang out.
