You don't want to spend $$$ just for that. The service desk people were helpful especially Penny. Overall we lucked out after reading all of he complains.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience, on so many levels.”
Reviews.Author: Foreeta
Reviews.Content: I planned to stay for 3 nights, but moved to a different hotel after 1 night due to terrible experience. At check-in, I asked to upgrade to a larger room. I was told one would be available in a 1/2 hour. We went to lunch and returned an hour later and were given our room keys. We entered the room and saw it had not been cleaned. We walked around the room and found personal belongings (cell phone) and realized the guest had not checked out. We reported this to the front desk and were sent to a different room. I questioned the bed size - looked like a double and we wanted at least a queen - and was told the bed was a queen, but come back to the front desk and we'll give you a "better room". We went to the 3rd room and found it was identical to the 2nd. The room was so small that my husband and I could not walk around. We had to hop over the bed to get to the bathroom. We tried to take a nap but couldn't sleep because the pipes in the bathroom were rattling each time a different guest used their water. There was a problem with drainage in the shower; I stood in water up to my ankles while showering. While waiting in the lobby for a friend, I witnessed a fight amongst the front desk staff. A woman said to a man "don't you dare raise your hand at me like that again. You are not my boss" and she stormed out of the lobby onto the street. Other arguments between them were witnesssed during the stay. Lastly, we asked the front desk when breakfast coffee would be available because we were starting our day really early at approximately 5am. We were told breakfast is not available that early, but the front desk staff member offered to make coffee and provide breakast pastries to accomodate us. The next morning, the front desk was left vacant and the breakfast area was dark. We entered the room in hopes that something would be available. We only had 5 minutes to spare. We found the front desk staff person sleeping in the breakfast area. We asked for coffee and he said he could provide juice instead. After all of these issues, I found another hotel in the area to accomodate us. We then checked out after one night. This hotel was terrible and I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the room!”
Reviews.Author: heeelllooo
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very hot day after a very long delayed journey and were expecting a warm welcome but the people on the reception were grumpy and didnt seem to want to talk or deal with us! There was one friendly girl on the reception but that was the height of it! The room was VERY small, the door had to be kicked so it would actually open!! The safe box was held up on a breeze block and the window was glued shut!!! The bathroom was so small that only one person could be there at a time. The bathroom was also unclean and had hair stuck in the fittings! The area for breakfast was also VERY small and there wasnt very many options. This was nowhere near big enough for all the guests and ultimately put us off attending breakfast after day one. The location was brilliant, one block from us was a subway station as well as the Dakota Buildings and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: sporty59
Reviews.Content: We were hoping that this hotel would meet our expectations since it is so close to where our son lives in the city. We were very disappointed when we found bed bugs in the bed on our final day of stay. We reported to the staff on check-out and they seemed to be surprised but from reading other reviews on this site they were having problems with bed bugs in May. We have filed a complaint regarding the situation and waiting for responses from corp.office.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice, but beware”
Reviews.Author: roamic
Reviews.Content: Got the reservation via Hotwire at a very good price. Nice location, very quiet. some people complained about the place as being dirty, but it was fine. But I believe, like one other reviewer, that we both got bed bugs. this may become more and more common as bed bugs seem to be a problem everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what ya'll is talkin about”
Reviews.Author: ljkamler
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying on the 10th floor of the Comfort in CPW. I can say without a doubt that the stay has been pleasant. The furniture is not old and ragged, the maids have come every day, the bathroom is spotless, there are no holes in the walls or sparks shooting out of the electrical outlets. We even have a small balcony facing south to enjoy our coffee, cigarettes, and cocktails on throughout the day. There have been no bed bug sightings. ***My friend just informed me that the door is not working properly, but he did manage to get in. Sure, the place is small, the free wi-fi is so spotty it is probably being routed from a 56k modem, and the aggressive but good-natured young lady working the front desk tried to double charge me for the room, but it's New York City and you can't beat the price for this prime location.

Reviews.Title: “good location, perfectly fine but not the Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty_jean
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in a very hot and humid July. We had real difficulties finding somewhere for a reasonable price with an ensuite bathroom. The Comfort Inn was good value for money, we had our own bathroom and the A/C cooled the room down nicely. We loved the location, good restaurants and really easy to get on the Subway. Our room was a bit noisey with the coming and goings of other guests in the corridor but we were right by the lift and stairs. the breakfast was adequate but sometimes difficult to get a seat in the tiny dining area, most days we just grabbed something for the local deli. I think for New York this is perfectly fine, we didn't have cleaning issues and we were able to spend money on seeing the sights rather than paying for an over-priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: privet4u
Reviews.Content: Disgusting, unairconditioned, dirty smelly Uncomfortable Inn in prime location in NYC Rooms never vacuumed, shower curtain stinks, elevator hasn't worked for 3 days out of my 4 days stay,have to take stairs to 8th floor. Rooms are furnished with old bit up furniture,i was afraid to touch anything in the room without being discusted everything dirty and dusty, couldn't walk in the room bare footed,carpet are nasty. Only old, very noisy window style AC barely cooling the room,no AC in the entire hotel old nasty smelly fumes from the carpeting are overwhelming. Stay elsewhere!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location....quaint rooms with a great view”
Reviews.Author: mjcari
Reviews.Content: Our goal was to experience New York as a New Yorker and not a tourist. The location of CI was fantastic-located in a residential neighborhood, one half block away from Central Park. We arrived on the Memorial Day holiday-New Yorkers were everywhere ..sunning themselves, jogging, eating lunch and drinking beer down at the Pier on the Hudson. Take a right out of the hotel and walk straight down towards the Hudson River. Outdoor tables, beer and good food available. Yes, the shower water ran hot and cold (more of a problem in the winter months) ,and the toilet seat was loose. But, the windows on the 14th floor opened and we had a birds' eye view of people lounging in their roof top patios. We had very warm weather during our stay, but the air conditioner worked, the WIFI was included and we were able to grab a coffee and bagel before we headed out for the day. There was a manager lady, whom we did not get her name, but she was always friendly and would acknowledge us leaving and entering the hotel. I did check for bed bugs---found not a one, not to say that there aren't any in this hotel, but they were not in our room on the 14th flr. New York City has experienced a surge in bed bugs, and they are found in even 5 star hotels. And, yes the elevator is slow-there is only one so be prepared to walk the stairs if you are in a hurry or wait patiently for its arrival. Overall, I am grateful for having read the reviews regarding the size of the room and the slow elevator. Knowing these things helped to prepare our frame of mind. I would definitely recommend if you are not in need of a luxurious hotel experience, and just need a clean, quiet, and comfy place to sleep and shower. Another plus is that the bed was very comfy and linens were soft and clean.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE HOTEL EVER - BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: littleangelbrat
Reviews.Content: Although the location is prime, I am currently suffering from bed bug bites all over my body. I have carried them to my brother's apartment after moving out of the hotel and now my brother's apartment is also infested. This is THE WORSE PLACE TO STAY, with terrible service and very LAZY WORKERS. My parents and I threw out nuts and other food into the rubbish bin and we saw our cleaner sit on the bed, watching tv, and eating our thrown-out food. I have a casting tomorrow and it looks like my chances are ever slimmer due to this horrible, infested, UNCOMFORTable INN.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: dillie0101
Reviews.Content: The staff here is friendly, helpful and eager to please. I stay here often and always feel at home. The location is fantastic and close to many wonderful places. The price is perfect. I always recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING-- BEDBUG INFESTATION”
Reviews.Author: RubiaNYC
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!!!! A few of my girlfriends came out to stay here in January when I had my baby (I live down the street). They *saw* bugs on the floor and bed, and their hands and other extremities were chewed up from bedbugs! They all had to go to the doctor when they returned to the west coast (as well as get their clothes steam cleaned, etc). They are still fighting with the manager to get their money back. (The owners deny everything, despite photographic evidence and doctor's notes/bills). DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “comfy beds - great location but a little bit grubby”
Reviews.Author: MsRiley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 14- 19 April with my sister. The rate for the hotel was good by NYC standards - and to be fair, by London standards too. The room was small, and very hot, with very noisy air con - not luxurious, but enough space for the two of us, and you dont go to Manhattan to spend time in your hotel room! Can`t praise the beds enough - they were sooo comfortable- and the location couldnt have been better - very close to Central Park and the Dakota Building, great shops and eating places and 5 mins walk to the subway so you could get the 1,2,3 trains really easily. The breakfast was fine, standard stuff, plenty of it , but the dining room was tiny so we usually took our breakfast back to our room to eat. The staff was helpful and friendly - especially when we were in a panic because our flight was cancelled due to the Iceland volcano. This wasnt the cleanest place I have stayed in - the beds, linen, towels etc were spotless, but the bathroom was a bit grubby - but not enough to put us off using the shower or anything, I would recommend to anyone looking for a comfortable bed and a great location. And we loved Manhattan and the Upper West Side!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crimrunner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modest but entirely acceptable. The residential neighborhood seems comfortably safe with lots of people out walking their dogs in the evenings. There are many interesting and delicious ethnic restaurants within a couple blocks and the hotel is close to subway lines for quick access into lower Manhattan. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. The bathroom was very tight but we had a room with a double and single bed, giving us adequate room for two people. The breakfast was standard fare for Comfort Inns everywhere. Protein: hard boiled eggs and peanut butter. Carbs: waffles, instant oatmeal, dry cereal, bagels, and assorted breads,donuts.Fruit. Juices, coffee, milk. Not elegant but I prefer to spend my money in NYC on items other than sleeping arrangements!

Reviews.Title: “Sam is great but the elevator is illegal and it ruined our trip.”
Reviews.Author: americantravelers_7
Reviews.Content: Turns out NYC has a law that a hotel with this many rooms must have 2 elevators WORKING. This one tiny elevator is the only reason we are booking our trip at a different hotel this year. Everything else was fine, but when we left with our bags the housekeeper was stopping at every floor and we couldn't fit in with her. We had waited so long that I even tried to force her to get off and let us get to the airport. We had to walk our bags down. They didn't care. The shame is that I would completely recommend it except for that.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, ok location”
Reviews.Author: nessica
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight, no rooms were ready which is ok but would have been nice. Checked in later in the day, they had taken messages for us which was good, and minded our luggage. Room was mini! Double bed took up most of the room, there wasnt really enough space to open both our bags. Room was clean and warm with a TV and nice bathroom. Heater was always on (NY winter?) but was maybe a bit too hot. High floor with a view of buildings. In a great location, not near all the action but on the same street as a FANTASTIC pizza place (biggest pizzas i've ever seen!) and loads of restaurants/shops/supermarkets just around the corner. could easily walk to Times Square and central park is just across the rd. could walk to the opera, museums and big shopping centres. Overall it was good value for a NY hotel, and i would stay here again. has a computer which you can pay to use the net, and waffles for breakfast but get it early before the greedy ppl eat them all! only issue is the extremely sloooowww lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; room small but decent value”
Reviews.Author: UncleCharlie
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here 2 different nights while on an audition trip to NYC. Location is great - walking distance to Juilliard; a half block from the subway that runs up the west side of Central Park, and 1-1/2 blocks from the subway under Broadway. We had a room with a double bed and a twin bed; each was in separate room not much bigger than the bed itself. The bathroom was <<small>>. Very small. But it worked, all was clean and well-equipped, and the wifi was free and good. Tips: we were on 2nd floor and then 12th floor; water pressure can be a problem, and on the 12th floor the shower would quickly fluctuate to hot or cold, so staying lower is better. Also, the twin+double rooms wrap around either the stairs (Room x05) or elevator (x04). The elevator machinery makes more noise than the stairs, so grab the _05 room if you can. Nice breakfast area. Lobby computer charges a fee; wifi is free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good location and value for money. Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AH85
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about this hotel I was a little nervous about what we were going to encounter. However, we had a great experience at the Comfort Inn Hotel. The first point to note is that the rooms are small and if you want a luxurious and spacious room then you are not going to get it at this hotel and you will have to pay a lot more money. I found that the cost of this hotel is very reasonable and I was told that generally the hotel rooms in NYC tend to be on the smaller size so I wasn’t really surprised. We only used the hotel room as a place to sleep so it was perfect for us as it was clean, tidy and the beds were comfortable. We did find that the rooms were very hot but it was easy to control the central heating and there was a fan if you needed it. One reason we thought that the rooms were on the smaller size was because the room had an en-suite bathroom. Apparently, this is quite rare in hotels in NY and shared bathrooms tend to be the norm, especially at this price. Not sure how true this is as we have only stayed in one hotel but when we were booking our holiday a lot of the hotels didn’t really mention bathroom facilities and hinted at shared bathrooms. Just one thing to look out for if you don’t want to share a bathroom! We didn’t have a problem with the rest of the hotel, it was clean, the staff were friendly and it wasn’t noisy. We didn’t eat at the hotel so I can’t really comment... We found that the hotel was really conveniently located. It wasn’t in the very centre of Manhattan but it wasn’t very far away. About 15-20 mins walk at a normal pace, not stopping to Times Square and 30-40mins to the Empire State building. We found that hotels that were more centrally located were at least £100 more expensive. The hotel was only 2 blocks away from a subway station which we used a lot. One thing I will say is don’t be afraid to use the subway. It is clean and easy to understand. We were told not to use it very late at night so the latest we used it is 1.30-11ish and it was still quite busy so we felt quite safe. You can buy an unlimited day ticket which allows you to ride anywhere and is really good value for money. We paid approx $8 per day. To sum, if you are going to NYC and don’t want to spend a fortune on a hotel and don’t plan on spending much time in your hotel room this hotel is for you. If you want a luxurious hotel room then you will have to accept that you will need to pay more. Be warned if you do go in Jan wrap up warm..it’s really cold!!

Reviews.Title: “Only for an emergency”
Reviews.Author: bowwowwow
Reviews.Content: I needed to try this hotel to see if it is was the answer to a budget hotel in New York. It was NOT. The price was good (but jumps all around). Our room was so tiny that you had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom and there was no closet. You had to pull out the only lamp to plug in the coffee pot. but it was clean and I was willing to give it a chance. The bed was the first problem. It was so soft that it was really not tolerable. so we asked for another room which we could not get. We checked out the following day and called that same afternoon to report having left an item in the room. We were told to call back when lost and found was open. We did, now we were referred to the night manager. We called and again and were referred to houskeeping. end of story it wasn't found. This item could not possbly be overlooked and could not e of value to anyone. so I chalk it up to indifference. By the way, we found another hotel nearby that as fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Small problem at first but was corrected and rest of stay was ok”
Reviews.Author: tstevens20
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Just one block away from the 72nd Street Subway Station and the Dakota where John Lennon was shot. The neighborhood was nice and quiet. There was some construction but we never heard any noise from it. The rooms here are small and we had a problem with a dirty shower when we checked in. We went downstairs to let them know and since there were no other available rooms they quickly came and cleaned the shower. The elevator is REALLY SLOW but the rooms are priced much lower than the ones in Times Square. We were able to get everywhere we wanted to go from the subway. Download Google Maps if you have internet access on your phone and it will tell you which subway stops to use. What a big lifesaver! The hotel will also store luggage for you before check in and after check out. Also we arrived at 1 and were able to check in early since the stated check in was at 3. Sam, who works the front desk, was really nice and called a cab for us back to JFK when we were in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: UkBigDave
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here recently after having read the mixed reviews. I'd also tried to find a similar priced hotel near to down town New York and failed - it was either a hostel-style place or out near the airports. The guy on the reception when we arrived was miserable, but he was the only one. We did pay a little extra for the "Deluxe Comfort Guestroom". This didn't cost a lot more and was well worth it having seen the size of the standard rooms! Breakfast was included but the space was very limited. Again, considering the cost compared to most other places it was still well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction from the time you enter the Hotel with "SAM" the MC to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Zebrastripe
Reviews.Content: Change your attitude about NYC ....visit the Comfort Inn Park West the Jewel near Central Park. My first visit at the Hotel was greeted by a warm smile from "Sam" at the front desk. This very congenial and welcoming Gentleman would be what Bloomberg's campaign needs as a Consul to the City.........a Citadel for NYC. Would repeat my next visit in a heartbeat right there. It 's perfect to launch a trip to the old charm of the West End Walking distance and subway reach to the NYC Marathon or Columbus Circle shopping! Thanks for the great Memories "SAM" :-) Martie from Miami

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Mullibull
Reviews.Content: A small hotell with very small rooms, however we had everthing we needed in our small room. A coffemaker, a closet, iron/ironingboard, hairdryer etc. The only thing we did miss was a view. We had two windows but not view at all. All we could see was walls and since our room was situated on the second floor we could not even see the sky/sun/daylight. Small breakfast room, however the breakfast was good (for being a breakfast at an american hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Non-Luxurious but Affordable and Safe”
Reviews.Author: Kathy1777
Reviews.Content: I had to book a hotel at the last minute to be in NYC while my dad had major heart surgery. I thought I'd be paying through the nose but then I found the Comfort Inn Central Park West for a very affordable rate. On my first stay, the staff upgraded my guest and me to a queen-size room, which was nice. On my second stay, when it was just me, I did not get treated to that same luxury. This isn't a luxury hotel, but it provides all the necessities in a central location. I would stay here again. CONS: 1. Rooms are small so pack lightly. 2. Hot water tends to run out in the mornings, so get up early or shower the night before. 3. Be prepared to wait for the elevator or take the stairs. If planning the latter, try to negotiate a room on one of the lower floors. 4. The "fitness center" is just a bike and a treadmill. 5. TV is spotty. I had problems with it in multiple rooms but was moved to a room where it worked when I complained. 6. Room keys seem to be valid only for two to three days, even when a longer stay is booked. I can't count the number of times I had to trek back downstairs at night to reactivate them so I could get in. 7. In the dead of winter, the rooms with larger windows were quite cold. Those with only a small side window were hot. PROS: 1. Neighborhood is residential and feels very safe. Even as a woman alone in the city, I didn't feel unsafe. 2. Close to subway and bus stop as well as Central Park. (If you prefer walking, this is a great way to get to the East Side.) 3. Free breakfast--it's nothing gourmet, but it saved me a good chunk of change on meals. 4. Very affordable--the best rate I could find anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A haven away from the bustle & crazy mid town Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: ObservantEscapades
Reviews.Content: This pleasant, quiet hotel, came as god send for my friend & I who had just spent a night in the most awful room at a fellow Comfort Inn (Times Square). By comparison, this room was larger, the hotel was CLEAN, the breakfast area was used by guests & staff, alike, & included a tv & opening windows. (My only complaint with the breakfast room is the lack of proper cutlery & plates-you can not microwave polystyrene, in fact, I melted a plate by putting a piece of toast on it). This hotel is situated only half a block from Central Park, so is perfect for escaping to for some sleep away from the hectic constant hooting & subway rumbling from midtown. Only two blocks away from many shops, restaurants, banks, & it is easy as pie to hail your cab from the end of the road. There are also buses on the route, but the hotel itself is on a quiet street, facing some beautiful brownstones. We had a table and chairs in our room, and thought the bathroom was tiny, it was clean & well equipped, & I much preferred having the space in the bedroom. Clean sheets. This room smelt a bit damp, despite having 6 opening windows, it may the cleaning fluids they use in the rooms. Nice reception area, computer was $2 for ten minutes use. This could be improved. The wireless connection is almost non existant on the 11th floor. Overall, a comfortable stay. As you would expect!

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe location”
Reviews.Author: brookerbrookman
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for those who have a budget but want to be in a safe neighboor hood! This hotel is located on the upper west side of Manhattan, only 1 block from central park. John Lennon's home is right around the corner (where he resided when he was alive). The subway is also only one block away. Which I recommend taking. Times Square is only 2 stops from the hotel. The hotel is situated within a residental area so there isn't all the noise and crazy lights like in Times Square. The room is small but that is to be expected for NYC. It was very quiet and clean. The beds were comfortable and the water pressure was great in the showers. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions. There is a free breakfast in the morning which is nice if you are on the run to see the city, take it with you! Many resturants 1 block up on Columbus Ave. If you are interested in seeing Kelly and Regis Live, there show is on 7 blocks away, we walked!!! I would more than likely stay in this hotel again!!! GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “FAR better than the price (and some reviews!) suggest........”
Reviews.Author: Swigger74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during the last week of September and it was excellent......after reading some of the reviews I was a little sceptical (especially as I'd also booked for my parents who are used to 5* accomodation) but all of my worries were totally unfounded! I booked 2 'King' rooms and was goven a room on the 4th floor and one on the 12th floor - both were clean, plenty big enough, fairly quiet and with large, cofortable beds (with the added bonus of a fantastic shower!!) - what more would anybody need? The staff were very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast had a decent selection for the 'continental' style - albeit having to be eaten from a paper plate, and the occasional queue for a table (just get the timing right and you'll be fine!!) And the location - Perfect!! The Upper West Side has so many bars and places to eat, Central Park on your doorstep, the Natural History Museum around the corner and no more than a 25 minute stroll to Time Square. For the price we paid (£100 a night for the Kingsize rooms) I thought the hotel was great - Yes, you could stay in more luxury for a lot more money, but if I was going back, I'd book into exactly the same hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “great locale, super help, tight quarters but hey, it's new york city”
Reviews.Author: travelvixen44
Reviews.Content: There may be some less than ideal rooms in this tall skinny Comfort Inn, and its one elevator does make for waits at times, but c'mon---it's an excellent location, and its staff, particularly Sam John (who's often the super-helpful man at the front desk) and the breakfast crew, are lovely. They go out of their way to make you happy. Beds very comfy and clean, ditto bathroom. We found our 6th floor room very quiet, even tho we were next to the elevator. I loved the lobby PC, where I could download my boarding pass and arrange for ride to the airport, etc. . We're fussy but we'd stay there again--we're travel writers.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe the negatives.....................”
Reviews.Author: Mullos1962
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what all the moaners are on about - this place is awesome! What do you want in your room? A bed, TV, free Wi-FI, shower and toilet ! Remember, you are here to SLEEP ! If you want all the bells and whistles and room to run a 1/4 mile, go down the road, spend $500 a night somewhere else so you can tell your friends that's where you stayed ! The rooms are very comfortable, the staff friendly, location superb. ONE minor issue is the lack of seating room at breakfast - however, that must prove the breakfast is good right ! Get over yourselves complaining - you read the reviews before you stayed and you STILL whine about a small room - please ! I have stayed in way smaller rooms for much more money. Bravo to the Comfort In Central PArk West !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: windmolen
Reviews.Content: Don't go here. Rooms are filthy, the plumbing is bad so often you can't sleep when your neighbour flushes the toilet. And the staff.... Their ignorant, very s l o w and only in it for the money. Breakfast is a joke, not fresh, you eat from plastic plates and there is barely enough. There is just one pro and that's the location.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: Sade37664
Reviews.Content: Do not pay to stay at Comfort Inn Central Park West since the rooms or bath rooms do not have enough room to even open your suitcase!! It is old still with the old window air conditioners. Even for the $111 weeknight rate and the $139 weekend rate, the location is not very convenient to the tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: DrAndyC
Reviews.Content: Stayed several nights when in NYC on my 3 week trip, all at a cheap rate (less than 100 a night). Experienced the suite and double rooms (we had no problems with the former, just the latter)..and it was not the size of the room that bothered us (small - but it is NYC!). Moreso was the smell of urine in the hallway from i assume a random drunkard the night before (which we cannot blame the hotel for) Overall, the stay came with a reasonable breakfast and wasnt that bad. With the exception of the urine I would have really enjoyed it. The hotel is very close to the park on a quiet street which was nice and also handy to many a cafe (with GOOD coffee for NYC). I would stay in the suite again. And at the price we paid it was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “It was awful experience”
Reviews.Author: victorianaLondon
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel, the rooms are tiny and uncomfortable, the lift was often broken and did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Pubic hair everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelTustin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a beautiful neighborhood and had a great location! The only problem was there was misc pubic hair throughout our room. Even on the room telephone. Staff was friendly & they had a great breakfast. We were really grossed out & the staff didn't really do anything, though they did apologize.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Surpassed Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: rod45
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 6 nights between July 28th to August 3rd with 2 friends, I have to say we were a bit scared after reading many of the reviews, but they didn't change our minds and we decided to go see for ourselves and were very pleased. We had all stayed several times at hotels in New York and knew what to expect in the $130 - $150 range, and had so much planned we knew we were gonna be at our room for very few hours every day, so we weren't that worried. The check-in was a breeze, location was amazing, yes the elevator is a little slow but being 3 guys in our 20's taking the stairs every once in a while to go to our room on the 7th floor was not a problem. The room was so much nicer than we expected, it had a double bed and a sigle bed that accomodated our needs perfectly, it looked recently renovated, it was very clean, had a closet and a dresser with 3 spacious drawers as well as enough space for our suitcases. The bathroom was tiny but nice, I guess the its size could be a problem for larger people, but for us it was definitely not an issue. The TV was a nice flat screen but we couldn't get it to work, we didn't complain about it because we had no need to use it. The free wi-fi worked perfectly every day and was a big plus. The air conditioning worked fine but its location wasn't the best, it mostly cooled one corner of the rooom leaving one of my friends freezing during the night while leaving my other friend and me unable to sleep due to the heat on a couple of particularly warm nights. The staff was always nice and helpful. The complimentary beakfast was great and had great variety, although the seating area was small we dind't have a problem finding a table every morning. The neighborhood is beautiful and quiet, a half block away from central park, a half block away from Columbus Avenue with its nice shops and restaurants and a short walk from 2 subway stations. I recommed eating at Big Nick's on the corner, it's open till 5 am every night, it's cheap and serves anything from classic NY pizza and burgers to veal parmesan. We went there almost every night because we usually got back late after going to concerts and shows. All in all we thought it was an excellent deal and had no major complaints. I'd recommed this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn fit my needs perfectly..”
Reviews.Author: lilybutt52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from July 22-24. I reserved a queen-sized room and there was plenty of room including a small table with two chairs and dresser. The staff was great and very helpful. The elevator is small and I was on the 12th floor, but I only waited once. I couldn't hook up to the internet, but I had so little free time that it didn't bother me. The location is great...1/2 block to Central Park and a block or two to all the restaurants and shopping one could ask for. This wasn't a luxury hotel, but I didn't want to spend much on accomodations so that I could have more fun. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You can find better deals elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DBinOP
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for one night in mid-July 2009. It was at a good price--$119/night but the junky, small room, loud surroundings, and poor service made it a very bad value. The room is small, but that didn't bother me. What did bother me was how worn and stained the room was. Aside from the new sheets and towels, everything in the room was at least 20 years old and really looked shabby. Like a flop hotel rather than a national chain. The pillows were the most lumpy, worn out pillows I've ever slept on. The carpet and walls were a disgrace. The lobby (which I don't really care about since I'm only passing through), is a case study in 1970s decorating. The wall air conditioner put out plenty of noise but barely cooled the room. All night long, I was awaked by the constant banging of doors which actually increased in the morning when the cleaning staff came to work. I guess they must do that to force you out of bed and out the door as soon as possible. Be careful when you check in--the check in forms charge you $1.50 for a "safe fee" that they say will be refunded on request at check out. But when I asked for it to be removed when I checked out, they had a fit and basically refused to do it. They said I had to requesst it when I checked in but the form (which I made them show me again) clearly says to ask when you leave. They dinked around so long that I had to leave to catch my flight -- without my $1.50. Not much money, but the principle is important. You can get a much higher quality hotel at the same price by using HotWire or a similar site. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: sunlvr0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and although the room was quite small, we didn't spend much time in it anyway. The location is fantastic. One half block from Central Park west, and about 2 blocks from Subway line 1,2,3 which take you wherever you need to go. The hotel has a decent breakfast, although the coffee wasn't great. It's not a fancy hotel by any means - but if you are just looking for a place to sleep and save some money to spend actually seeing NY, I'd recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No comfort at the "Comfort" Inn”
Reviews.Author: notbob_trip
Reviews.Content: The good news: The wireless internet worked. The Wall Street Journal was available for free in the lobby (but was not delivered to the room). The location is convenient to Central Park. The bad news: The room is tiny. There is no dresser. The shelves are only 6 inches deep, and would not hold most of the things I tried to put on them. There was so little space around the bed, that if you sat on the edge of the bed and bent over to tie your shoes, you would hit your head on the wall. There was almost zero closet space. The air conditioner blew air, but not cold air, despite using the max cool setting. The bathroom had only a shower stall, not a bathtub, which I didn't think would affect me, as I normally take showers and not baths, but the confined space meant you often banged your elbows and knees on the walls of the shower. The shelf in the bathroom was only 4 inches deep, and inclined down as it went away from the wall, so things routinely fell off that shelf. The sink was so narrow that when you bend over to brush your teeth, you hit your head on the mirror, which jostled the shelf, which meant everything on the shell fell off. The hotel's own web site descibes the hotel as "A charming European boutique-style hotel". Wrong. There was no charm, and nothing European or boutique-style about it. The web site says, "Free deluxe continental breakfast". It was free, but there was nothing deluxe about it. The web site says, "Exercise room", and it passed my search screen for "fitness center", but the "exercise room" contained one elliptical machine and one stationary bike, but no treadmill, even though there is a photo of a treadmill on the web site. I had made a reservation for a second week at this hotel, but I cancelled it. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: MorganAero8
Reviews.Content: Having come from England to NYC for the first time, didnt know what to expect, but this hotel waz central to everything that we wanted to do, the rooms were a bit cozy but u dont wanna spend all day in there, just go to sleep. With Central park at the end of the road, what more do u want. and with Big Nicks pizza place at the end of the road aswell (the best pizza ive ever eaten). if u want cheap no frills accomadation in a good spot this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Gives you what you need”
Reviews.Author: Godisgurkan
Reviews.Content: If you go to NYC in leisure you will not have time to spend at the hotell, there are to much to se/do in the city. But this is a very good hotell for the price you pay. Every night we came back it was clean, the staff was helpful, comfortable beds, a quiet area by night and very close to several subway lines. Central Park as neighbor and 'necessary' stores in the area. Over all, a very good hotell.

Reviews.Title: “If you're claustrophobic, FUGHETTABOTIT”
Reviews.Author: muttlee
Reviews.Content: This property maintains a great location (you can see Central Park from the entrance of the hotel). However, there was one elevator for at least a minimum of 10 stories and was no larger than an average-sized pantry. If you had one regular-sized piece of luggage, there would only be room for two additional people. When I got to the room, the door opened up and was 4 inches from the bed (I had to step inside, then drag my suitcase in and slide it to the right in order to close the door (this room was the size of a large walk-in closet. The chair they provided you (similar to an old dining-room chair) had to be slid over to the closet area in order to walk in front of your bed to the bathroom. There was literally 9 inches between bed and dresser. They did provide a very nice flat-screen television and the bathroom had recently been remodeled; however, for over $250 a night (average in NY), it would've been nice to have secured one of the spacious rooms they offer when you're viewing their property online.

Reviews.Title: “An OK choice in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomMidwest
Reviews.Content: I've debated staying here many times and finally did so. I found the many of the pluses and minuses described in other reviews to be accurate. My room was clean, but small. The biggest plus is the location, steps from Central park, in the vibrant Upper West Side and near two major subway lines. For vacationers looking for decent, low-cost lodging, this place is fine. My biggest problem was the very poor availability of the wireless internet, and no wired option. For the business traveler, this is a big problem, and as a result, I probably will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location if you only plan to sleep here”
Reviews.Author: SuperWaterGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend/biz partner and I stayed here while on a photo shoot in New York. The shoot was in Central Park, so we felt like we really lucked out finding the Comfort Inn. The price was amazing for being across the street from the park. The room was super-tiny to the point that we had to maneuver around each other to get to the bathroom, etc. But it was clean and no weird smells or anything, so it worked fine for what we needed - a simple place to crash at the end of a long day. My only problem with this place was that the desk guy seemed appalled when we asked if we could leave a disc with him for a client to pick up later. He acted like how dare we ask for a favor. In nice hotels, of course, it's quite normal to have the desk people do things like this. Bottom line is: it's way too hard to find a cheap hotel in NYC that's not disgusting, so this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Princess3737
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC for the weekend. The hotel is not THAT bad! Yes, it is very ‘cozy’ but it still offers the basic amenities of any other hotel. There is too much to do in New York City to be lounging in the room anyway! The front desk staff is very nice and accommodating; we booked a smoking room and were given a non-smoking room at check-in. They gladly switched our room and all was well. They even offered to help move our luggage for us. The only real complaint we had with the room was the heating. It is hot water heating and was REALLY noisy at certain times of day when air would get trapped in the pipes. It sounded like someone was banging a wrench on the pipes for about 5 minutes at a time. Not so fun in the middle of the night that’s for sure. Other than that, our room was cleaned everyday and everything was replenished appropriately. We stayed on the top floor and the elevator didn’t take too long to reach us most times. A large group of young girls checked in during our stay which slowed the elevator down a little bit but not enough that we were forced to take the stairs. We didn’t eat breakfast at the hotel partly because the breakfast room was so tiny (tables were always full) and partly because we left early every morning for tours so I can’t say anything about the food. Though we did find the lady that puts everything out in the morning pretty rude. Coffee and tea are served around the clock in that room and when we went in on our last morning to grab coffee before leaving for the airport she purposely stood in our way with her back to us and kept looking at her watch as if to say “it’s not time yet”. She was very friendly to the next person that walked into the breakfast room when breakfast officially started which we were a little put off by. The hotel is in a GREAT location- a very brief walk to 2 different subway stations, central park is at the end of the street, there are quite a few different restaurants and markets close by on Columbus, Broadway, and the surrounding area. We even walked to Times Square on 2 separate occasions and it took us about 25 minutes. We thought it was neat to be a block away from Yoko Ono and down the street from Madonna. There is a great little restaurant at the corner called Big Nicks. We ate there on 2 separate occasions and really enjoyed ourselves. We recommend both the burgers and the pizza. The portions are HUGE and well worth the reasonable price tag. I don’t recommend the Arte Café on W 73rd street. We received some bread that I think was supposed to be served with olive oil and balsamic vinegar but we never did receive the vinegar. I ordered a glass of wine and there was a bunch of little pieces of cork in it. The chicken parm was mediocre and we didn’t really feel it was worth $18 a plate. Sex and the City fans will be happy to know that there is a Magnolia Bakery and a Gray’s Papaya within walking distance of the hotel. They are not the original locations from the show but if you just want to try them, these locations will do. NYC Vacation Packages is a great place to purchase tickets from. They offer all sorts of packages and tickets to just about everything New York has to offer. The only downside is that they charge $29 extra to have the tickets delivered to your hotel if you do not live in the US and we would have preferred to pick them up instead but in the end it was nice to have them when we got to the hotel. It truly is a time saver! The Statue of Liberty escorted tour was pretty good. This was our first time in NYC and will definitely not be our last! We will certainly stay at the Comfort Inn Central Park West again. I hope you enjoy your stay in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another!”
Reviews.Author: deckhandoug
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY small but the location was good. The biggest problem is the thin walls and banging fire doors that isolate the rooms from the elevator area. We had some very noisy neighbors that kept us up all night, with loud talking and banging of the doors and the hotel staff that patrolled the hotel was just as loud with their 2 way radios. The staff was helpful, but did nothing about the guests that created noise all night. All in all, choose another hotel, even if you have to pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Rick024
Reviews.Content: Great location and great value for the price- $149 per night. Rooms were cleaned well each day. Breakfast was fine-waffles and eggs, bagels, english muffins and tea and coffee. Quiet. TV worked fine and plenty of hot water. One small elevator so bring patience! One block from Central Park-two from the subway and 11 blocks from Columbus Circle. Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: skpaul
Reviews.Content: The rooms were tiny, the location was GREAT. My complaint was that the service staff monopolized the 1 elevator on the property. the elevator was never available. I walked 7 flights to my room each time because the service staff and their carts were always in the elevators. My room was not refreshed on second day. Had hard time to get extra coffee packets. Bed not made, trash not emptied. Towels sparingly replenished. The TV took 5 minutes to warm up before the scrolling lines went away. The TV is HD but the programming was NOT, so the picture image on the TV was not of quality. The breakfast area was very tiny. I would suggest getting to breakfast before 9 so as to find a table to sit and enjoy breakfast. My overall impression was of being cramped into a sardine can.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, wonderful staff for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Rob0ny
Reviews.Content: This being NYC, tiny rooms should not be a surprise. But be ready anyway -- its a bit of a squeeze. But since you are probably not going to NY to sit in your hotel room, here are the main pro's and cons of the Comfort Inn Central Park West. Pros: - Really nice staff. They are friendly and helpful. As a former New Yorker as well as someone who travels back there a lot, this is not a given! - Great location -- just a few hundred feet from central park, walking distance to Lincoln Center, easy to get a cab on Central Park West, two subway lines a short walk away. Good food down the block. - Free breakfast. Cons: - Tiny rooms - No morning paper If you are looking for a decent price for NY in a great location, this is a good bet. If you need space and atmosphere, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: prettyparticular
Reviews.Content: Can I say at the outset that I think some of the reviews of this fine little "value" hotel are really pretty harsh. We booked a room with a double bed and a single bed (US 150) and sure the room was small but it had everything we could have possibly needed and at the end of a couple of very long active days in NYC it provided decent surroundings in which to rest up, a good powerful shower, spotlessly clean bedding, good reading lighting, and a decent flat-screen TV (if you like that). The location of this hotel is perfect, there are many sites and restaurants locally, and in terms of getting a flavour of life on the upper west side, it's terrific. Just one thing though don't stay here if you are quite overweight/fat, its not the spot for you, if you are carrying a couple of extra kilo's fine but if you are (12 kilo's) 30 pounds overweight then give it a miss, you will find it's all too small, a larger scale room will suit you better. The staff, well I would have to say - very friendly and helpful, "hats-off" to The Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, affordable, accessible and the tv and ac work”
Reviews.Author: Poletino
Reviews.Content: I went on a sudden trip to New York with my husband and my original reservation was cocked up. I had to look for a hotel 2 days in advance. The only thing that attracted me was the location and the price. Come on, this is New York. This hotel is there for us who are on a tight budget. You cannot seriously expect Marriott or Hilton Standards. In this case you need deep into your pocket and pay for the luxury you are craving for. This hotel is affordable, well situated as you can walk dowtown and there is nice evening life around. The rooms are small, so what. When you go New York you are bound spend your time outside, come back tired and ready for bed. the hotel is clean, beds are comfortable, bathroom small but clean. That is what you should expect. They offer complimentary breakfast and the staff are helpfull. When you people keep saying that the bedrooms are small, what do you really expect? The breakfast they offer is good enough to keep you going for a good half a day and makes you save money as well. This hotel came to my rescue and we have to take into account the fact that we cannot afford Manhattan. The park is on the other side of the road. There is a bustop down the road. This should be enough to please anyone on low budget. The only bad thing I will say is that the lady in charge in the breakfast room needs to be cleaning the tables not just standing there and chatting. And you customers, after your breakfast, plaese leave for others to use the facilities and not start using your laptops in the breakfast room. If you dont like this hotel because the facilties are small, go to the Trump International Hotel one steet before, I am sure you will like it there or the Marriott Hotel downtown. Please let be reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “great location - tight squeeeze”
Reviews.Author: slumberdudes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - 1 block from Central Park. Around the corner from the Dakota. Nice neighborhood and relatively quiet. Easy check in and out. The rooms are tiny. I couldn't walk past my roommate without bumping bellies. It was tough to sit on the hopper and close the door also. Room was clean, H2O was hot and good pressure. The breakfast was adequate. The room rate was reasonable for NYC. Parking was pricey and about 2 blocks away. All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room built by Oompah Loompahs”
Reviews.Author: cbrumby
Reviews.Content: So my usual hotel in Midtown was charging ridiculous prices for the time I was to be in New York. "No problem" i say, knowing that New York City has thousands of hotel rooms to choose from. Doing my research, I found the Comfort Inn website and found the Central Park West property and thought all my prayers had been answered. Arriving at the hotel at around 10 pm, I was met by a very 80s style lobby and some reasonably friendly staff. One lift is shared by cleaners, staff and guests so you can't be in too much of a hurry to get up or down the 12 or so floors. A quick slide of the keycard, the door opens and I am met by one of the smallest rooms i have every stayed in. A single bed barerly fit in the room. Next to the bed was a tiny bedside table with a lamp that was disconnected. By the side of the door was a 3 drawer cupboard with a nice flat screen TV on it. Bathroom was horrendous though. The toilet was almost under the sink and considering i am not a small person, I found it very hard to use comfortably. Not something you even consider thinking about before booking a room! Location wise, the neighborhood is beautiful. Much nicer than staying with the throngs of tourists in Times Square. The area is full of nice little restaurants and locals walking their dogs. Only half a block away is Central Park and you have 2 subway stations within 5 minutes walk. Complimentary breakfast offered was a bit of a soup kitchen and not very pleasant and the major gripe i have about the place (besides the tiny room) was that almost every night i had to have my key card replaced. After a whole day of walking, I would head up to my room but would have to head back down again due to the card not working. Management said this was because i had a weekly subway ticket that "demagnitised" their card. I hardly beleieve this to be true. It was very frustrating not knowing if i would be able to get into my room each night. Considering that week, people were paying $300 a night at this hotel and i was paying half that, I feel i got a good deal location wise. Room wise, the hotel really needs a good makeover. If you're not fussed about room size, though, you cannot beat the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small, and unkempt”
Reviews.Author: MOJOBO48
Reviews.Content: Positives first: The people at the front desk were nice, the location on the upper west side is terrific and the hotel did not, as far as I could see, have bedbugs. That said, you could do a lot better staying nearly anywhere in Manhattan than this hotel and, having stayed there for 2 days, I will never stay here again and will think twice before staying at a Comfort Inn. This hotel was unkempt, with dirty floors in the halls and cleaning equipment left in the halls 24/7. The hallways were also so narrow that two people couldn't walk side-by-side down the hall without hitting the walls. The rooms ranged from small to tiny -- my cousin's smoking room was literally about 10-by-10 feet, with only enough room for her double bed, and a bathroom so small that it would, if constructed in an American prison, attract a lawsuit from the ACLU. My room (nonsmoking) was not as small, but the windows looked as though they hadn't been cleaned in ages and the shades covering the windows had a thick coating of dust on them. Ugh. The hotel offers a continental breakfast that was OK in a dining room that was, again, so small that you could hardly turn around in the place. If you were in the lobby and needed to use the restroom, you have to go in the basement, with cleaning equipment in front of the restroom and, in the restroom, overflowing wastebaskets even at 9 in the morning. My cousin got us a good deal on the price, but it wasn't worth it. I guess we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews...especially the really bad ones”
Reviews.Author: BritainDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience in one word: awful. I was traveling for work and had to find somewhere that was (1) well located, (2) relatively cheap for Manhattan and (3) better than a hostel. The Comfort Inn seemed like a good choice, and the photos on Expedia (deceivingly) made it look like a nice place. Pressing "confirm" and purchasing this room was a major mistake. The tiny lobby should have tipped me off to the size of the room. There was only enough room for the bed and a nightstand. I wouldn't follow the reviews that say "This is NYC, I expect small rooms." Yes, space in Manhattan is limited but this was truly restrictive and depressing. The room itself was clean enough, but the poor layout of the place means the bedroom was stiflingly hot. Turning on the A/C was not a solution because it would whir so loudly it was like trying to sleep inside a vacuum cleaner. Even with my A/C unit off, the mechanical groan of everyone else's units could be heard through the paper-thin walls. I'm telling the truth when I say I got -- total -- three hours' sleep, and even that was broken. The bathroom was pitifully tiny. I could have gone to the toilet and showered at the same time. If you like maximizing your time, then that may appeal, but I prefer a more traditional approach to getting ready in the morning. Maybe the complimentary breakfast would be the saving grace? Alas no. The poky breakfast room with its dirty floor and broken chairs was a depressing start to the day. The food on offer was stale pastries or English muffins that you had to toast yourself. And the toaster looked like it would either char your food or give you an electric shock, so I stayed away from it. I've stayed at several hotels in NYC, and I'm not exaggerating when I say I would NEVER stay here again, and I would strongly recommend everyone avoid this place unless you want one of the worst nights' sleep possible in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on 71st Street”
Reviews.Author: scoobido
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a New York vacation. The TV didn't work and it would always be fixed tomorrow! Tomorrow never came! The phone didn't work! There were men working on the scaffold outside the window from early morning. The room was very small and adequately clean, but the small guest/service elevator was always busy and full. Although the staff was pleasant, they didn't solve any problems and we were almost always referred to a manager who wasn't available or couldn't solve our problems. We had to argue to get our Choice Hotel benefits! There was no value for the money! Find somewhere else...no matter what!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: EMERALDWINNER
Reviews.Content: Great location and very clean- these were my reqirements. My daughter and I shared a double=double bed room. We had small suitcases and put them on top of each other at night. This is NYC I expect small rooms. The breakfast is typical Comfort Inn. The bathroom is very small. We left the door open when we used it, but if you require privacy it will get very hot! Our room was on the second floor at the front of the building. There was scaffoling in front of our window, but really everthing was fine. The elevators were slow, but we didn't have to use them. They stored our luggage for our last day which was very helpful! I did need to request washclothes on the second day and they were brought fairly quickly to our room.

Reviews.Title: “good location, better places for the money”
Reviews.Author: snowyberry
Reviews.Content: Scaffolding still up after years of seeing other patrons' reviews. no workmen to be seen anywhere. most of front desk staff unfriendly. one SLOW elevator. tiny, closet-sized rooms. not even room for a chair! my hallway smelled of rotting garbage for two days. the only great thing is location. close to subway, decent restaurants, shopping, museums, and central park is half block away. will not stay here again for the money-better places are available close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and clean room!”
Reviews.Author: edtorres04
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in late June because I wanted to spend my birthday in New York. This hotel has great access to central park, is very close to the broadway shows, and has plenty of shopping nearby. It was very safe at night to walk around. It rained one night, and the hotel desk called us a car immediately. The best part of this hotel was the free breakfast. The waffles were very good. The breakfast would have probably cost us over 25 dollars if we had eaten out in manhattan for the amount of food that we got at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A small perfect room in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: injerusalem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from June 12th to the 15th and enjoyed it. The room was small, but who stays in the room in NYC? I was in room 208 which was quiet as its on the back side of the building. No need to take the elevator (slow) as its only one floor. Breakfast was included but for some reason the a/c was not on in the breakfast room and it was HOT. I took my breakfast to the lobby to stop sweating. The location is great, near central park, Lincoln Center, and the subway. Room price was $175 a night, with taxes, and I booked it a few days before I arrived. Enjoy the Big Apple! Eric

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Mike23_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late May while in NYC to see a couple of New York Yankee games. First trip to the Big Apple. Hotel was in a great location, walk to Central Park in a minute. Subway was 1 block up at 72nd. St. As expected rooms were small, but clean. Hotel staff cleaned and restocked towels and toiletries every day. Overall a great experience and would stay here again!! For the price and only using the room for sleeping, what more do you need!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Gordloo
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the scaffolding! Our stay began with a $1.00 per bag charge to store our luggage because our room was not ready. I have NEVER been charged to have luggage stored in any hotel before.It went downhill from there. We had our grandson with us so we booked this because the room was advertised as having a double bed and a single bed. It had a single bed in a room with a small window taken up by the air conditioner and a double bed in another room that was pushed up against the wall so that you could get out of bed to go the bathroom. There was no place to put your luggage to unpack(which was useless because there was no place to put your clothes). Tiny bathroom and that was it. We got our room changed to a corner room with lots of windows and used a rollaway for our grandson. If they had not had this I would have left the hotel..even though it was midnight!! One small elevator for 14 floors..took forever to go anywhere. We were on the 12th floor and I am handicapped so we had to wait for it. Last night they did not make up our room. Manager offered me a 10% discount. I said "wow..that much!" He then said I would get no discount at all. He was the rudest manager I have ever encountered at any hotel. He is also the first manager I have ever reported to the chain. They said they called a cab that would arrive in 7 minutes and 30 minutes later a private limo shows up and offers to take us to our destination for twice the price we paid all week end for a cab. The staffer then argued with me and told me it would cost the same in a cab!! The guest service coordinator tried very hard to smooth over all the problems, but the manager made it impossible. He told him to shut up if he wanted to keep his job!! I am a Choice Hotel Gold Member and have stayed in many of their properties...but NEVER AGAIN in this one.

Reviews.Title: “not as advertised !”
Reviews.Author: kingcheeseAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this based on it,s internet page. most of which is incorrect. It is an overpriced dump. the following amenities are listed but are not provided:- cable tv (had been disconnected by supplier) free high speed internet(pay internet terminal in lobby only) guest laundary (does not exist) air conditioning (cooling only, not much good when temp is 48 degrees F. outside and no heating available) refrigerator on request(requested refrigerator never turned up in 4 days we stayed there) reception staff issued us with a key to a room upon arrival that we entered and found a couple on the bed in a compromising position,double booked, no apology or anything like it, just issued us with a key to another room ,staff member was considered very rude. room was shoe box sized, double bed was only accessable from one side, toilet/shower was so small one had to open door to be able to bend over to pick up item from floor. closet was so small that a standard coat hanger would not fit in depth wise they had to be hung at an angle. Pictured room was nothing like the room we stayed in, our luggage(4 suitcases) took up half the available floor space. best items about this hotel were its entry foyer and continential breakfast served in a reasonable dining room,and linen service was good given what they had to work with. would not reccomend this hotel to any one and give it a one star rating, the standard of the hotel would be one i would expect if you were paying $100 per night not $245 per night.($300 per night including taxes)

Reviews.Title: “Construction site dump”
Reviews.Author: Vikingheritage
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. If you want to live with scaffolding outside your windows - as I understand guests have done for ten years now (don't believe the promotional photos) - and mingle with hard-smoking budget tourists and backpackers, welcome. The neighbors on this Landmark street hate the hotel for its never-ending construction, and you can feel it as you enter and leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lmn417
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location close to Central Park. The room was small but room enough for 2. The bedding was comfortable. Nice complimentary breakfast in small dining area. Room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Life of Alabamians Sojourning to New York: Dynamite Comes in Tee Tiny Packages”
Reviews.Author: mlkcause
Reviews.Content: Ahemm..Where do we begin? Being seniors in high school, going on our Senior Trip, we expected BIG THINGS! However, we arrived to find we we're the biggest things in the hotel. We had thirty-three people and it was near impossible for all of us to stand in the lobby with our luggage (or even without). There was only one elevator for all 14 floors. And the elevator was only as big as the average bath tub. So let's just say we got a lot of excercise carrying our one week worth of luggage up and down the stairs. Our class was also spread throughout the entire hotel because there was about 8 rooms on each floor. Now for the rooms. They were clean if you ignore the small blood stains beside your bed. They were safe if you ignore windows blowing open randomly at night. They were private if you didn't make a sound and like your shower visible from the outside. They were decorated where it made you feel nice and cozy. We will give them that. They were big if you are the size of a ant. Speaking of bugs, you might see a few in the bathroom or even on the bed. By the way, the bathroom is smaller than my pinky finger. When you walk in the sink, shower curtain, toilertand door is touching you on all side. NOTE: USE THE BATHROOM WITH CAUTION BECAUSE YOUR SUITCASE CAN LOCK YOU INSIDE!!!!!!!! :D Now for the good stuff. It is in a GREAT location, breakfast was good, and we made memories that will last us a lifetime! Oh, and they don't mind if you play hide and seek! : )

Reviews.Title: “Clean, FANTASTIC location, and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: gracefulc
Reviews.Content: I have seen numerous reviews about this hotel being awful, but decided to take a chance and am very glad I did. Yes, the rooms are VERY small ( 2 ft of open space on the 3 sides of the bed, plus bathroom that's it) but the water was hot (you have to let it run a few minutes tho), it was clean, safe, quiet for me (didn't even need the earplugs I brought) and the location is PERFECT. As a single female experiencing NYC for the first time (and alone), it was perfect for touring and getting to the subway. Also,within walking distance of lots of fun cafes and restaurants on Broadway and Columbus avenues. Has a full breakfast (danish, donuts, coffee, fruit, juice, waffles) included and staff was friendly. For $1 I was able to store my luggage with them the whole day after I checked out which was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Good Staff, but needs updating...only a 2star”
Reviews.Author: smcg720
Reviews.Content: Realize that this hotel is in an old building. It has steam heat. So understand that you won't get new or fancy. The good: The staff was very nice. I was allowed to check in early. Each of the 3 people I dealt with was helpful, courteous and friendly. I mentioned my issues in the morning (and hadn't allowed them an opportunity to address) and they gave me a bit off the rate....wasn't expecting or asking for that. My room was clean and I felt very safe. So good people, clean room, safe. What's not right? It's the value. I paid $314. Now I now with the bad dollar, this is probably a decent value for non-US people. But this hotel is not worth this price..It's a $200 room max. It's the combination of little things. The bathroom is very small. I could put my back against the shower wall and touch the sink with my foot. I estimate the bathroom to be about 2 feet deep by 8 feet long. In that area you have a toilet, mini sink, and small shower. Since the hotel is older, it took a long time for the warm water to get up to the higher floors...and since you can't turn on the shower without getting wet..that's cold! And the water sprays out of the shower because the shower is so small. The steam heat was off when I got there, so the room was quite cold. I turned on the register..and lots of noise. Like a whistling tea kettle. Woke me up at 4 am. I had a choice...turn off the heat or try to sleep while the "tea-kettle" was going. The bed was comfortable, big...which took up most of the room..and the pillows were good (for this range of hotel.) Slow, small elevator. Didn't get to try the breakfast as I had to leave before it started. The wireless connection was not very strong and I was only able to use for about 10 minutes before it disconnected and I couldn't get back on. The in-room coffee maker didn't work. There is an in room safe, ironing board, and hair dryer. The blinds were a bit tattered. Windows didn't shut enough to latch...which wouldn't normally concern me on a higher floor, but there is a construction scaffold outside so it did cause me some pause. (but no lost sleep.) You hear some street noise, but since the hotel is back off of Central Park West, it's not too bad. So my biggest complaint is the overall value. It's a solid 2 star hotel, but to charge $314, even in NYC, near Central Park on the Upper West Side..is overboard. It's simply not worth that without substantial updates.

Reviews.Title: “Good New York Hotel For The Money”
Reviews.Author: snapoli123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Comfort Inn Central Park West and I have to say I was a little concerned after reading some of the comments that I felt I should give my review. The hotel room was very small but the bed was very comfortable and adaquate. We did not spend much time in the room and for our purpose it was perfect. The price was right and you pay for what you get and I was pleasantly surprised and would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Sandylou82
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a budget hotel in NYC in a easily accessible but quiet location then I'd seriously recommend here. A 15 min stroll away from Times Square, 15 mins from 5th Avenue and seconds from Central Park itself. The hotel is clean and well kept, yes the rooms are small but are well kept and pleasant. If you're wanting a comfortable place to rest your weary feet after a long day and sleep then this is a good place to do it. Good size plasma screen TV in room, clock radio, A/C, iron and ironing board, chest of drawers and ensuite bathroom (not something to be taken for granted in other NYC budget hotels). Bathroom is minute, you can sit on the toilet, stretch your legs and have your feet in the shower, but it's fully functioning and cleaned daily, with fresh towels and toiletries. The desk staff were always pleasant and helpful. Internet and ATM facilities in lobby. Breakfast was simple but pleasant; fresh waffles, coffee, juice, bagels, doughnuts and cereal. Located on a quiet street just off Central Park West, there is little traffic noise, compared to staying in Times Square or similar. This place is not lavish or flash, but it is convenient and very reasonable, and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Supertiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 5 nights of our trip. We were pleased with the location as it was right by the Dakota building on the edge of central park. It was a great area to start our trip as west side had a relaxed feel with plenty of good places to eat and drink. We recommend Pomodora (an Italian restaurant) and Bin 37 grab a seat and enjoy this exclusive, yet cosy wine bar. The room was small as many people have focused upon, but why would you want to spend hours in your hotel when there is Manhattan to see? The staff were very accomadating and as our view wasn't great they offered to move us, although we didn't bother in the end. Breakfast was an experience as it was set up as a pratical 10 minute sit down and eat, yet people insisted on being inconsiderate of others and taking their sweet time over it. It was small in the dining room as well, but it suited our purposes. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, it was very good value, clean and well placed.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all it's worth”
Reviews.Author: JunegirlOntario
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel the lobby is very different from the pictures, much smaller and closer quarters. I was able to check in right away, which was very nice, however, the elevator was very old and tiny and my room was VERY small. But before I could enter the room the key didn't work properly so I had to return to the front desk and get a new one. When I entered the room it was so tiny my knees hit the sink while going to the bathroom, but it's New York, that's pretty much what I expected, and the door to my room didn't properly lock. Once I was settled and after I paid for the room, I got called back down to the front desk to be told it was Valentine's Day Weekend and my rates changed, so I had to pay more. Whatever I was just going with the flow and decided to shrug it off because I was in New York. So I went out exploring and when I returned later that night, I found hundreds of ants all over the room, in the drawers, everywhere. They must have been attracted to something I brought but there was no way I was staying in that room. So I complaned to the front desk and they moved me into a queen size room, which was much nicer than my previous room, and kind of made up for the problem. But I was still paranoid. During the night the heater makes the most awful noises, so bad that I could hardly sleep and had to put on headphones to drown it out, but there was not much street noise. Breakfast was limited and if you're not down there by 7am then everything is really picked over. And do not use the car service to the airport, it's cheaper to take a cab. So if you don't care about where you sleep and want a hotel with a fantastic location ( down the street from the Natural history museum, across the street from central park, and within walking distance of the Guggenheim, the Met, the Moma, 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, etc) then this hotel is fine, but other than that I woudl not recommend it. Pay the extra 50 bucks and stay somehwere a little nicer, I will be.

Reviews.Title: “clean, but SMALL”
Reviews.Author: AIM62
Reviews.Content: Not only was this the smallest room I've ever seen, but the NOISE made it hard to sleep. Apparently, the pipes are so old, that throughout the night, a loud woodpecker style tapping filled the room. It made for a very sleep-disturbed night. The staff was polite, and the hotel was reasonably clean. Great location, only 1/2 block from Central Park, and 1/2 block from the A/B/C subway line, and 1.5 blocks from the 1/2/3 trains. Overall, only stay here if on a budget and you don't need to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tragalMidwest
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before leaving home and decided maybe this wasn't the place for me. To my surprise, I was mistaken. It wasn't really the hotel, it was the great neighborhood I fell in love with. The hotel is quite small, rather European, and somewhat Art Deco. I admit the elevator is quite small and also quite slow. However, it does serve the purpose. The front desk was helpful and the staff pleasant. Since I already knew the rooms would be small, I wasn't really too surprised. I actually opened the door and laughed. If you are planning on spending a lot of time in your room, you don't want to stay there. If you want something with a bit of charm and I wonderful neighborhood, you might enjoy it. I am actually going back at Christmas and I plan on staying at the Comfort Inn Central Park West.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, great service”
Reviews.Author: moonbeam51
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of many hotels, I knew hotel rooms in New York tended to be small, so I was not bothered by that at all. What we found was a clean, comfortable room, above average breakfast, responsive staff. When we got to the room we had reserved, the air conditioner didn't work. Maintenance came quickly when we called, agreed it was broken, and we were quickly moved to another (larger) room. It was quiet, we felt safe, overall it was a great experience. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worth it for the price”
Reviews.Author: sunsetlegend
Reviews.Content: the place is small and cramped, but you're in the city and getting around is fantastic. the subway is 2 blocks away. Central Park is across the street - and there's a ton of little restaurants just down the street in a 5-7 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “my toes are in the sink”
Reviews.Author: dhedges
Reviews.Content: If you like sleeping with your head on the pillow and your toes in the sink, stay here. To be fair, I am not a big fan of NYC. This hotel, however, did not help me. The rooms are unbelievably small and the construction isn't helping matters. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: southGagirl7796
Reviews.Content: Before I went on the trip to NYC for the first time I read all the reviews weekly to see what I was in for at the hotel.
