I was very scared about what my friends were going to get me into. There were four of us in the room it was a little snug but what others have said in there reviews I didn't think it was bad at all. We had a new room on the 12th floor had a wonderful view. Sure we had breakfast but it's like any other breakfast that you get at any other comfort inn. The subway is very close to the hotel walk around the corner and your there. There are alot of wonderful places to eat for something very casual Big Nicks fun little family style eatery. I sure would stay here again because I'm already trying to plan another trip very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: pat2o
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. The location is nice, 1/2 block to Central Park and close to subway station and bus line. The hotel itself was a bit disgusting. The room was very small and the bathroom was miniscule. The sink was the size of a shoe box and the water splashed on the floor whenever I tried to wash my face. The room smelled funny, probably had been a smoking room at one time. The sheets were clean and the temperature was comfortable. Everytime we went through the lobby, some guest would be at the front desk yelling at or complaining to the clerks. I felt bad for them as they were quite helpful to us in getting a cab for the airport. We paid $179 for the night which for NYC is good, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: BCMI
Reviews.Content: Really pretty good for the money. Yes, it is under renovation, but the renovated rooms are clean with some nice amenities- coffee maker in room, safe, TV with multiple channels, lotion, shampoo, decent sized closet, and an extra pillow. The room was small, but that is to be expected in New York City. I had no problems with my reservation and the front desk helped me get a car reservation to take me to LaGuardia. The free breakfast is nothing special, but it saves a few dollars (consisted of cereal, bagels, danishes, waffle maker, hard-boiled eggs, and juice/coffee). This isn't a hotel if you want something real special, but it is way better than some of the options that are slightly cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “So bad we moved out!”
Reviews.Author: tampatennisplayer
Reviews.Content: My mother and I booked two rooms in May 2007 at this hotel through the Choice Hotels 800 number. The location within walking distance of Lincoln Center was the main reason. The hotel was under renovation (which the phone operator did not mention) and was it ever a mess! Paint cans stacked in the hallways, dirt everywhere, no attempt whatsoever to make it liveable for guests. The wall air conditioner in my room banged so loudly I couldn't turn it on and sleep, the bathroom was so tiny that you hit your head on the sink while sitting down on the toilet. The room was not overly clean (hairs on my bedspread). Each of our rooms was very very small. Most of the other guests seemed resigned to their fate. We, however, checked out and went to another hotel after two days (the Excelsior on 81st St. -- now there's a good hotel). And it wasn't even well-priced -- over $200 for these tiny rooms. Would not stay here again even after the renovations are over.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Syracusan
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms and upon arrival was told that I only had one reservation (despite my two confirmation numbers). The hotel blamed their booking agency for this mix up. The hotel was full due to our race the next day in Central Park. After over an hour, they decided that they would take the room from someone else assuming that not everyone would show. The extra room we received was despicable---no window coverings, no hot water, no tub, no clock and just enough room for a double bed and shelf. It definitely had the look of an overflow room used only for emergencies. The final insult came when I received my credit card bill and was charged for three rooms (now it appears they have found that original resevation and say that we have to pay because we didn't show up!). I have been battling with them for a week and no one returns calls or follows through. I am totally frustrated and am currently working through my credit card company for assistance. Again, it has been a nightmare!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but Is the building work STILL happening?!”
Reviews.Author: skimeld
Reviews.Content: We put my parents up here. I live next door. It's OK (the rooms are small - we viewed 4 - and outside peak times a good price. Downside is no real lounge/reception/bar area, but location near park and subways is good). BUT a word of advice; before you book I'd call the property. The hotel has been under constant scaffolding now for 2 and a half years! So if they promise you a view of the street, I'd ask them if that is still through the builders netting, ladders and scaffolding. If that's not important to you, it's a reasonable choice. If it is important to you however, suggest you check before pressing the 'book now' button. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life!”
Reviews.Author: replicnt6
Reviews.Content: I think they are renovating. Hopefully, the room I stayed in was pre-renovation. If _that_ was renovated, oy vey. My #1 complaint was lack of heat. It was cold and drafty. I slept in sweatpants, a sweater and a hat. Admittedly, I like it fairly warm, so most normal humans will probably not find it as cold as I did. When I was leaving this morning, I noticed another room being cleaned and there was one of those oil-filled electric radiators there. So I'm assuming if you complain to the front desk, they'll give you an electric heater. My #2 complaint is that the room was quite scuzzy. The carpet was dirty and ratty, as was the desk chair. I put a bath towel over the chair before sitting on it. My #3 complaint was the noise the heat made. It is steam heat, and although the radiator didn't provide a great deal of heat, it sure provided a great deal of noise. If you've never experienced bad steam heat, it sounds approximately like someone beating on a pipe with a hammer. Not constantly, but several minutes every hour or so when the "heat" comes on. Also, note that the beds are double/full, not queen (at least in the two rooms I saw). I think that most of the rooms are way too small to accommodate a queen. I would say that outside of Manhattan this would be the approximate equivalent of a cheap motel on an old highway that's been replaced by an interstate. It's relatively inexpensive, but not nearly inexpensive enough. You're better off saving money by taking a gamble on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Call the Health Department and for Heating Assistance”
Reviews.Author: museumlover
Reviews.Content: We are still thawing out....TURN ON THE HEAT! Whatever you do, don't drop your anything behind the furniture...the crud & dust will nauseate you. Guy at the front desk spends his whole time yakking on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: GoBlueTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January of 2007. This hotel is okay if you can get a good price. The room was small but in decent condition. The bathroom was in good condition and kept very clean. The room was drafty which is not good in January. Some people's reviews are very unrealistic. It is obvious that they don't travel often to NYC because they don't know how expensive it really is. That being said, I would not pay more than 150 a night to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Donlyn
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the picture. We had an emergency and was forced to stay at a nearby hotel. The price was 359.00 per night. The very small eleavator should have told us what to expect. 2 people, 2 bags wouldn't fit. We passed a room that had a twin bed right by the door. Those folks had the door open so they could pack! We got to the room and my husband went into the bathroom thinking it was the closet! The bathroom had a very small shower with a metal (sharp edge) at the back of it. DON'T BACK UP! The distance between the dresser with the tv on it was about 8" so one had to be careful getting to the other side. The sheets didn't look clean so I had to request clean sheets. They brought them and handed them to me!!!!!! Radiator banged all night long! People weren't to friendly. The "breakfast" was doughnuts, coffee and juice. My daughter came up the next night on a planned trip stayed at the Park Lane Helmsley for 249.00!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: vagabond17
Reviews.Content: On October 11, 2006 we stayed at this hotel. As we were spending several days in New York, we originally thought the $200 a night room rate was a bargain. On entering the hotel, we felt it was dingy and dark. The lobby furniture if you can call it a lobby was worn and threadbare. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Sam who was the Valet/ conceierge/etc.etc. seemed very helpful at first. Getting our luggage in the tiny elevator was no easy task. The hallways upstairs were extremely narrow and dark. Our room had to be the worst we had ever stayed in. It was dark and postage stamp small. We could barely get our luggage in there. We were tripping over the luggage constantly. The furniture was old and scratchy, the bedsheets so thin that in certain places they had holes in them. The minutature bathroom was so small you could barely close the door. The shower curtain had a very dirty smell to it. We finally left for the day dreading to come back to the room. I will tell you that the area was absolutely fantastic!!! Less than a block from Central Park. The Dakota apartment building was right around the corner and subway station less than a block away. The are great restaurants a block or two away on Columbus street. This was a residential area, therefore it was pretty quiet. The following morning, we decided we did not want to stay there another night. After a free continental breakfast at the hotel which was the biggest perk,( It is hard to find a hotel in New York with a free breakfast) we asked Sam to call us a cab. (BIG MISTAKE) An unmetered cab pulled up and took us to our new destination on East 81st st. 10 or 12 blocks away and the cabbie charged us $45.00 at would have been probably a $12.00 cab ride with a metered cab. We were so upset, we did not even give the cabdriver a tip. We are usually considered big tippers. In defense of this hotel, the price is cheap by New York standards, the free breakfast and the location make it fine for some travelers, but for us, we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodations - great location”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I booked so I was prepared for the worst. Having my expectation set before my arrival made all of the difference. Yes, rooms are tiny and yes, it's dark - but it's a good price and a great location. The rooms need to be updated but they're not dirty. They ask you not to bring food or drink into the room which I think is weird. I stayed one night - it might have been uncomfortably small for a longer stay but I thought it was just fine

Reviews.Title: “So-so stay. choose room wisely”
Reviews.Author: sheenster
Reviews.Content: Second floor had a smell of decaying body. Told staff several times; no response. Room 908 was great! Also, rm 406 was okay. Rooms are sized from normal to closet size and moderately clean. Bathrooms were cleanest. Residential area so was very quiet yet a half block from busy NY and half block other direction is Central Park. Only 4 blocks walking to Regis and Millionaire shows. I would stay again but I would choose rm 908 for whatever price they asked. Shuttles to airport were $13-15 and takes about an hr. I pd $258 online for my rooms. Never saw a bug anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, below average rooms”
Reviews.Author: civil2006
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for 10 days October 2005. First night there was awful. We had a tiny room with a window looking to the skylight. A very polite receptionist give us the next day another room in the 14th floor, so we had a marvellous view of the Central Park and south. The furniture was below average with a comfortable bed. The place we had breakfast was small and breakfast was not good (we ate just the first two days). In general every room in the hotel was small (the gym, the loft). What was amazing is the neighboorhood. I believe is a great place to see typical New York City as a tourist. Central Park and a Metro station was just 100 meters away. I think that with 10 minutes walking we had everything in our hands. If you don't care spending time IN the hotel, Comfort Inn is a descent solution. Location is great! However, with 200$ per night I suppose you can get yourself a way better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny, I'd shop around a bit more!”
Reviews.Author: SageS
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay. The room was adequate, and a fair choice if you do not plan to be in the room very much. It had a/c and cable, was safe, reasonably clean, and in a good location. (As mentioned by nearly everyone, this hotel is right by Central Park and Strawberry Fields.) It is a residential area and fairly quiet, but I recommend earplugs anyway. The hotel shows some wear and needs to be cleaned/upgraded in spots (torn carpet, dirty or torn walls, wallpaper, ceilings, curtains). There is no a/c in the elevator or hallways, don't know if this is true for heat in the winter as well. Due to the age and historical nature of the buildings, I can understand the rooms being tiny. I cannot understand having a full size bureau, desk, night stand, etc. in a room so small that one can barely maneuver with luggage! The guest service was friendly but could be improved (they did not have change for $1 or $20 and seemed overwhelmed by more than one guest at a time - hint, just say "I'll be right with you!" and smile.) The lobby had an unpleasant smell. (However, all I did was walk through it on my way in and out anyway, so I guess that is not very relevant!) The continental breakfast was generous and free. I guess each traveler has to decide if these "sacrifices" are worth the relatively "budget-for-NY" price. (e.g. if you stay further out and spend the difference on transportation and time, not worth it!) I paid $135/night and I feel that was too high for the quality and lack of aesthetics. I would probably see if I can find something better for a similar price but if not, I might stay there again. If you are not looking for a luxury experience, this is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: Nillies
Reviews.Content: I admit I was a bit hesitant to stay at this hotel given some of the other comments here. However, I figured that I was staying in the city to be practical (late night business meeting) rather than for enjoyment, so why pay more for a room than I had to? I'm glad I did. For $125, I got a very clean, safe, comfortable room in a good neighborhood. Was the room small? Absolutely. Could I hear other people's doors opening and closing? Yep, but outside noise was never a problem when I was sleeping. But the bed was comfortable, the water pressure in the shower strong, the frontdesk people courteous and the price was right. This is a great find for anyone just looking for a place to leave their stuff and lay their head. It's not for people who want to feel pampered, obviously, or for people who like to spend a lot of time in their room. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: gooddeal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time during our stay at the inn. We checked in for almost a week early July this year. We found the staff very accomodating, warm, supportive and friendly. Special thanks to the chief engineer, the ladies at the front desk, the manager and his staff. Our room is clean and has been upgraded to a double bed plus a single bed. The location is great. We had no problem sleeping at night since it is located in the residential area and is close to all attractions. We walked almost everyday and central park is our favourite. We will definitely return to this hotel next time and had already missed the friendly staff. We will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to our friends. Thanks and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great but small”
Reviews.Author: raybenson47
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from six night stay at the Comfort Inn, Central Park West. We had already been informed that the rooms were small and we were so glad we had this prior knowledge. Looking back now it is quite funny as the rooms were so tiny. It was indeed two steps to the bed and three to the bathroom. As we didn't spend much time in the room it really didn't matter too much. If we had stayed any longer than six nights, I think it would have become a bit unbearable. The room was clean and housekeeping was great. The continental breakfast was superb and far better than others we have had in other hotels and with other chains. Very close to subway stations in two directions. Front desk were also very good in arranging our transport back to Newark airport. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarianinColorado
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but found it to be very satisfatory. We called ahead of time and requested a corner room (there are 4 on each floor) which is larger than the other rooms. The location was great--we went running in Central Park every day, walked to several museums, walked to Lincoln Center for three performances. Only 2 blocks away from 2 different subway lines. Only hotel in NYC I've ever been in where continental breakfast (which included juice, cereal, fruit, rolls and freshly made do-it-yourself waffles) was included. Definitely the best value in the 14 different NYC hotels we have stayed in over the years. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean but small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are minuscule with just enough space to walk between bed and wall. The bathrooms however are clean. I stayed at room 304. However the best room I have seen is 1106 which looks like around 250-300 sq.ft. I liked the complimentary breakfast. Also, the staff are kind and helpful. They supplied my relatives with milk and some other necesssites. Also, since we stayed in the summer of '05 the room was quite hot. So the AC was a blessing. All in all it was $135/ night with taxes so not bad. For those who want to have a good time I would recommend the Trump International Hotel and Tower. Rooms start at $475/ night. But it is the best since they have a nice French restaurant called Jean Georges and a health and wellness center. Plus the rooms start at 440 square feet which is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Gross...get me out of here!”
Reviews.Author: mc2cali
Reviews.Content: Small room, old, unmaintained fixtures and bedding...windows had spiderwebs in them (does this hotel actually clean their rooms?), heat came on and it sounded like the pipes were going to burst, hole in ceiling outside my door...let's just say I didn't stick around to see if the pipe noises would keep me up all night. The location is super, but the hotel is way to $$$ for what you get. Fork out the extra $50 to $100 and enjoy your stay at a clean, comfortable hotel! Trust me it will be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Major relief”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was very nervous about going to this hotel. I had booked it through priceline so there was no backing out. The room was small but clean. The bathroom was small but clean. The staff was friendly to us and did help us out with a few quirks we were having in needing an extra bed. I lucked out and found a parking spot on the street in front of the hotel so I did not have to pay for parking. I took my earplugs, as I do when I stay at any hotel. Without them I could hear the noise of doors closing but nothing through the walls. With them I slept like a charm. The one hint I would give.. Our room had no fan in the bathroom. Take a room freshner and some odor spray with you. I loved the location, it's a quiet street and away from the hubbub when you're ready to settle in for the night. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “liars and horrible room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: lets start with the big lie- they tell you the parking is free when you check in (they must have part ownership of the over-priced Omni parking garage). it's not free- it's a discount of 20 percent. so thery scam you as soon as you walk in the door. Most savvy New Yorkers would look for a spot on the street or a cheaper garage. Is this legal? the tiny room was a farce. the TV was above the bed; the shower was cold, no heat, everything was frayed. I could go on but you get the point- a royal rip off! try a tent in the park before you subject yourself to these people. This is the second time in a few months this has happened to be-the Roosevelt in Los ANgeles was the other- and ORbitz has to know know about it. WHy dont they stop it?- I call it the Orbtiz room- "hey, here come some cheap hayseeds- give them the dumpy room."

Reviews.Title: “First class dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this dump on Monday Dec. 12, 2005. It was horrible. I live in NY and work in NYC. I know the city. I saw flies for the first time since the summer. I saw a large horsefly after I checked in and killed it. I found another one in the morning. How exactly did they get in the room? Here's the list of other refined features: Towels had brown stains. Floor had patches of white stains. The "curtains" are made of some sort of plastic. They have wilted, so the neighbors can see in the room. The room does not have sufficient heat, so a space heater was required. Rooms are tiny. The beds just barely fit, but this is NY right? Right? The remote didn't work when clicking channel up. Channel down worked, but up didn't work. I don't think I'll ever forget the feces smell when I walked through one of the corridors. I'm forget some of the other luxuries, but this list is sufficient. Enjoy your stay, if you're dumb enough or broke enough to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Only just acceptable if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ROOM: First room was so bad (tv did not work, heating leaked and hissed and we did not sleep at all that night) we had to move the next day. Second room: acceptable, clean but small. BREAKFAST: tiny breakfast room - don't get there late or you will have no table to eat at, or at best have to share with others. Also you eat off plastic plates and drink from polystyrene cups! Only options for breakfast are 1 cereal, toast and doughnuts - so do not expect much! SERVICE: not bad when things are ok, but if you have a problem don't expect any friendly support and they will not go out of their way to help you. LOCATION: Ideal if you are looking for affordable accomodation close to the touristy part of lower Manhatton, want to spend a bit of time in the park and plan to walk into lower Manhatton a couple of times a day for a few days. But this hotel does not look over the park, its just close enough to most things in lower Manhatton. OVERALL: I'd say fine for anything up to $100-$150 a night max. We had to pay $450 a night for the above - DEFINITELY NOT WORTH IT. They justified it by saying we came during peak shopping season (early Dec) which is rubbish as while we were there we managed to find far better accomodation at 4* Hotels overlooking the east side of the park for half that price!! Since we could not get a refund on our booking we did not move and braved it out at this hotel. In summary, nothing great but acceptable if the price is right and you don't expect too much.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Central Park West
HotelInfo.Address: 31 West 71st Street, New York City, NY 10023-4103
